AD_ThrumboVignette.synopsis: Vignette-like AD dialog with only Thrumbo talking to himself once discovered hiding in the closet. He is speaking quietly to himself.

Ghast.synopsis: Dialog with Ghast guard in Phildrave's Mansion, where he can give the player access to the whole house checkpoint. He will give access automatically if the player has the letter from father carrion (from Oskar's Beloved) and can also be tricked or intimidated into giving access.

PAD_EnteredLarder.synopsis: One liner triggered when entering larder in Philgraves Mansion. The place is FULL of bodies, viscera and blood. It is the place where the dead are kept in storage to serve as nourrishment for the ghouls that serve Carrion. Players react to this sight.
PAD_EnteredLarder.how_to_trigger: Teleport to CTY_Main_A -1395; 1; 81Pick up canopic jar

FatherCarrion.synopsis: Dialog with Mystic Carrion, a mummy lord hiding in the Lower City. Players who carry the Necromancy of Thay (unread) have the chance to take part in a seance where they can learn how the book can be opened. Players can also take on a quest from Carrion, to bring back his runaway zombie beggar Thrumbo (potentially in exchange for the torch of revocation, intended to help Oskar).Various conclusions are available for the quest to help Mystic Carrion - if the player succeeds in bringing himThrumbo's torso, he will reward them with a Torch of revocation which can be used to cure Oskar's possession (Oskar's Beloved). If you refuse him, he will attack you, and keep returnign from the dead until you destroy his canopic jar (hidden inside Thrumbo)
FatherCarrion.how_to_trigger: Talk to Father Carrion in Philsgrave's Mansion in CTY_Main_Aloadlevel CTY_Main_Agoto -3.404; 11.065; -160.435

AD_LumbarPreBeating.synopsis: Vignette between Lumbar and a civilian, with them reaching an aggreement where Lumbar gets 10 gold and he allows the civilian to beat him up.

ThrumboInsideHouse.synopsis: Dialog we can have with Thrumbo once Father Carrion is fully defeated and they have taken over the house. Here Thrumbo will act as a hint giver and help with Oskar's Beloved quest.
ThrumboInsideHouse.how_to_trigger: Destroying the heart of Father Carrion, killing him and talking to Zombie Beggars outside the house, letting them know it is safe, which will make them go inside the house. Location: CTY_Main_A 0; 8; -161

PAD_PortraitLetter.synopsis: One line AD result of having succeeded the passive perception check on a portrait warded by the Alarm spell. The player discovers a note hidden beneath the canvas.
PAD_PortraitLetter.how_to_trigger: Get close to an item such as the warded quartestaff in CTY_Main_A 709; -21; 707 and succeed investigation roll.

DoorInteraction.synopsis: Dialog when interacting with the hidden door at Philgrave's Mansion. It's possible that door door has been revealed by succeeding a passive perception check or automatically if the player is carrying the letter, which the player has to read in order to learn the password they have to say to have it open.
DoorInteraction.how_to_trigger: oe LOW_PhilgravesMansion_GetLetterFatherCarrionteleport to CTY_Main_A -8; 8; -157, the door will reveal itselfinteract with the door

AD_MummyLeavesCoffin.synopsis: AD one liner when interacting with one of the coffins that contain one of Father Carrion's coffins. Depending on whether the player is given access in the checkpoint the zombie will react with a warning or with combat.
AD_MummyLeavesCoffin.how_to_trigger: Interact with a coffin in Philgrave's MansionLocation: BGO_Main_AAprox 16; 46; 138

Lumbar.synopsis: Dialog for one of the zombie beggars. Lumbar.how_to_trigger: Talk to LumbarLocation: CTY_Main_A Initial: 86; 41; -69Meeting: 66; 1; -120Outside house: -8; 11; -145Inside house: 1; 8; -157

AD_ThrumboLeftCloset.synopsis: Short AD for when players open wardrobe where Thrumbo is hiding for the first time. Thrumbo runs a few meters yelling because he thinks Mystic Carrion has found him, only to realise that's not the case.

ZombieBeggar_Morbus.synopsis: Dialog for one of the zombie beggars. LumbarAttacker.synopsis: One liner for the civilian that was about to beat up Lumbar in exchange for giving him money.

PAD_AncientLairTablet_001.synopsis: One liner triggered when reading a warning table and giving a hint that only undead characters can go inside safely

AD_FatherCarrionAttacked.synopsis: This one-liner triggers just after players attack Father Carrion. He reacts to the way in which the combat was triggered - if the player destroyed his heart he is furious, because his means of resurrecting is gone. In other instances, he knows his death will not be permanent and is more confident.
AD_FatherCarrionAttacked.how_to_trigger: Attacking Father Carrion for the first time. BGO_Main_A, 15; 43; 130

AngryFatherCarrion.synopsis: One liner for when Father Carrion before starting combat, with different nodes for stages in the quest of killing him (destroying jar, destroying heart, having Thrumbo killed) as well as reactivity for him dying several times. Carrion is always angry at the player and will always start combat after these lines. He sometimes toys with the player before turning on them
AngryFatherCarrion.how_to_trigger: Attack father carrion in CTY_Main_A 1; 8; -160. After long rest, he will trigger this again when starting combat.

PAD_BasementBookFound.synopsis: PAD one-liner after reading the book in Philgrave's Mansion basement pointing to the ancient lair in ruins

PAD_CarrionKilledReaction.synopsis: One liner reacting after Mystic Carrion, a mummy lord, has been killed. If Carrion's heart is not destroyed and therefore not fully dead, this means that players recognized Carrion as a mummy lord, and therefore know that he'll resurrect the next day if his heart is not destroyed.It's possible that players fail the intelligence check the first time, which will make them think he is dead when he is really not.On the other side, if the heart is destroyed, this one liner will serve as a confirmation that Carrion is fully dead.
PAD_CarrionKilledReaction.how_to_trigger: Go to CTY_Main_A 14; 8; -160Start combat with Mystic Carrion and kill combat

AD_MorbusAndGirl.synopsis: Vignette with Morbus and a girl in the graveyard. Morbus believes he is playing hide and seek with his dead family inside, and the little girl is trying to tell him not to play there.
AD_MorbusAndGirl.how_to_trigger: Get close to Morbus and the girl, in CTY_Main_A 20; 41; 25

AD_PostLumbarBeating.synopsis: AD dialogue after Lumbar's Attacked has finished hitting him. The attacker is slightly out of breath from the effort of attacking Lumbar, while Lumbar is totally normal, having felt none of it.

SacrumVignetteCivilian.synopsis: One liner for a stallkeeper near Sacrum. He tried to beg some gold from her, but she didn't give him any.

CarrionGhoul_003.synopsis: Warning from the ghoul on the second floor, next to the stairs to the third floor, where larder is. It warns that players are to go downstairs to Mystic Carrion, which is the public area. If players go further up without being given access to the checkpoint, they will be attacked. This ghoul is the last warning.
CarrionGhoul_003.how_to_trigger: Get to CTY_Main_A 5; 12; -152If players are not given access to checkpoint, dialog will start automatically. If they are given access they have to talk to Ligus.

AD_MysticCarrionCastsCurse_001.how_to_trigger: Go to CTY_Main_A 14; 8; -160Fight Carrion, in turn where he casts a curse, he will say the line

AD_MysticCarrionWorking.how_to_trigger: Reach Mystic Carrion in CTY_Main_A 14; 8; -160 (not implemented yet, will be implemented in behavior phase)

AD_MysticCarrionTaunt_Turn3.synopsis: Third generic combat AD for Mystic Carrion

Thrumbo.synopsis: The player discovers Thrumbo, a runaway zombie who escaped from his master, Mystic Carrion. Thrumbo tried to escape with threee 'brothers' (also zombie beggars), but the others got lost, so he's stuck waiting for them. He's hidden in the wardrobe, where the player can find him. If they mention Carrion, thrumbo will start a dialogue where the palyer learns about the existence of the canopic jar they need to destroy. If they don't mention Carrion, Thrumbo acts like a normal beggar, minding his own business.

GhoulWarning.synopsis: Checkpoint warning one liner where a ghoul stops player from going further down in Philgrave's Mansion to where Mystic Carrion lives.

PAD_ReactToJarDestroyed.synopsis: PAD onliner that triggers when players destroy a canopic jar for the first time.
PAD_ReactToJarDestroyed.how_to_trigger: 1) Debugbook -> quest flags -> act 3 -> Philgrave's Mansion -> get objects -> get jars2) Drop and ctrl+k one of the jars

MorbusGirl.synopsis: One liner for the girl talking to Morbus in the graveyard. Morbus thinks he's playing hide and seek with his dead family, buried there.

PAD_AncientLairCurseReaction.synopsis: This PAD oneliner is said when players have gotten the curse of Mystic Carrion's ancient lair by interacting with a secret door or picking up any object in the lair. Carrion is a mummy lord, so his lair is hostile to any living creatures, Astarion won't get affected.
PAD_AncientLairCurseReaction.how_to_trigger: oe roll amazingGo to CTY_Main_A -1390; 0; 75Interact with the door secret door there

CarrionGhoul_002.synopsis: One liner with ghoul in the service of Mystic Carrion. There will be also different greeting nodes in case the zombie beggars have taken over the house

PAD_EnteredLabAncientLair.synopsis: PAD one liner that triggers when players enter the locked room in Mystic Carrion's ancient lair. A corpse quartered in pieces with one of the canopic jars where the belly should be will be highlighted in gameplay, to hint at the fact that those jars are put inside people.

AD_MysticCarrionCastsPutridExplosion_002.synopsis: Second combat AD where Mystic carrions casts Putrid Explosion on a corpse
AD_MysticCarrionCastsPutridExplosion_002.how_to_trigger: Go to CTY_Main_A 14; 8; -160Fight Carrion, in turn where he casts putrid explosion for the second time the line will be said

AD_MummyAwakened_006.how_to_trigger: Destroy a coffin in Philgrave's MansionLocation CTY_Main_A 4; 13; -158

CoffinMummy_005.synopsis: One liner dialog with a mummy that was in a coffin in Philgrave's Mansion. To be able to talk to them it means the player broke the coffin they were in before being hostile with Mystic Carrion or that after fighting and killing Mystic Carrion they escaped combat and then the zombie beggars took over the mansion, making the mummy non hostile again.
CoffinMummy_005.how_to_trigger: Talk to mummy after destroying coffin in CTY_Main_A 8; 8; -151

CarrionGhoul_004_0.speaker: Rectus
CarrionGhoul_004_0.context: NodeContext: Struggling to form the word, minimal intelligence

CarrionGhoul_004_1.speaker: Rectus
CarrionGhoul_004_1.context: NodeContext: Has put the word together, getting more confident repeating it

AD_MummyAwakened_005_0.speaker: Ancient Servant
AD_MummyAwakened_005_0.context: NodeContext: Mummy voice - confused, to self

AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_0.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_0.text: Perhaps we might plan a little party to celebrate our new home?

AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_33.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_33.text: Nothing wrong with that. I like a party.

AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_29.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_29.text: Yes, oh yes! Can we, Thrumbo?

AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_7.speaker: Thrumbo
AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_7.text: Of course, once the house is back in order.

AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_10.speaker: Thrumbo
AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_10.text: Careful, brothers. We must take care of this place now.

AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_15.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_15.text: Looks like we weren't the only thing Carrion neglected.

AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_6.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_6.text: Once the blood and guts are gone, it will be much better.

AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_4.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_4.text: I will help! I like to keep things clean.

AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_11.speaker: Thrumbo
AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_11.text: I'm glad we're here together. It would be lonely to be here alone.

AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_16.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_16.text: As am I. Our friendship is most valuable to me.

AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_17.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_17.text: Yeah, we get on all right.

AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_5.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_5.text: We love each other, don't we?

AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_18.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_18.text: Is it time for us to play now?

AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_2.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_2.text: Not now, Morbus. There's too much to get done.

AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_26.speaker: Thrumbo
AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_26.text: Yes, the larder needs to be cleaned, the guts wiped from the walls...
AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_26.context: NodeContext: Slightly stressed at the task ahead of them

AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_27.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_27.text: I will help! It is good to help each other.

AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_19.speaker: Thrumbo
AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_19.text: Perhaps we could find others like us to move here.

AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_9.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_9.text: So long as they stick by our rules. Respectful, like.

AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_28.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_28.text: What a wonderful crowd we would be. Undead one and all!

AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_20.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_20.text: Suppose Carrion does come back again - what then?

AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_13.speaker: Thrumbo
AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_13.text: He's never coming back, Lumbar. He's banished for good.

AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_32.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_32.text: If he does, Thrumbo will protect us. He always does.

AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_22.speaker: Thrumbo
AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_22.text: I told you we would be safe, brothers. This is our home now.
AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_22.context: NodeContext: 'Ours' as opposed to Mystic Carrion's, reassuring

AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_3.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_3.text: Is it really all for us?

AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_8.speaker: Thrumbo
AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_8.text: And those like us, who suffered at the hands of the likes of Mystic Carrion. A home for the undead.

AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_23.speaker: Thrumbo
AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_23.text: The house is ours at last. We are finally safe.

AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_30.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_30.text: I like it here now. It's not scary anymore.

AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_14.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_14.text: A most wonderful home we will make here.

AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_1.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_1.text: So long as I've a roof and four walls to shelter me, I'm happy.

AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_24.speaker: Thrumbo
AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_24.text: Would my brothers even want to return here? I don't know...
AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_24.context: NodeContext: Sad tone - he got what he wanted (Carrion dead) but now he's alone

AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_25.speaker: Thrumbo
AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_25.text: Loneliness isn't so bad. At least I'm alive.
AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_25.context: NodeContext: Sad tone - he got what he wanted (Carrion dead) but now he's alone

AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_31.speaker: Thrumbo
AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_31.text: Perhaps I am the last. My brothers could not survive alone...
AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_31.context: NodeContext: Sad tone - he got what he wanted (Carrion dead) but now he's alone

AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_34.speaker: Thrumbo
AD_BeggarsConversationEndState_34.context: NodeContext: Sad tone - he got what he wanted (Carrion dead) but now he's alone

AD_MummyAwakened_004_0.speaker: Ancient Servant
AD_MummyAwakened_004_0.context: NodeContext: Unnatural exhalation, more like air escaping than a living breath.

AD_ZombieBeggarsVomit_0.speaker: GROUP_ZombieBeggars
AD_ZombieBeggarsVomit_0.context: NodeContext: Vomiting noise (throwing up an entire canopic jar)

AD_MummyAwakened_003_0.speaker: Ancient Servant
AD_MummyAwakened_003_0.context: NodeContext: Mummy awakening with a groan

CoffinMummy_004_0.speaker: Narrator
CoffinMummy_004_0.text: *The mummy remains silent. Whatever secrets it possesses, it took them to the grave.*

CoffinMummy_004_1.speaker: Narrator
CoffinMummy_004_1.text: *The mummy does not speak. But you sense contentment in its silence.*

PAD_AlarmDoorDispeled_0.speaker: Player
PAD_AlarmDoorDispeled_0.text: Warded no more. Let's see what this door has to hide.

AD_ThrumboVignette_1.speaker: Thrumbo
AD_ThrumboVignette_1.text: No matter. This is still the safest place to hide.
AD_ThrumboVignette_1.context: NodeContext: Quietly, trying to reassure himself

AD_ThrumboVignette_2.speaker: Thrumbo
AD_ThrumboVignette_2.text: It's just bad luck I was discovered.
AD_ThrumboVignette_2.context: NodeContext: Quietly, trying to reassure himself

AD_ThrumboVignette_0.speaker: Thrumbo
AD_ThrumboVignette_0.text: I must be patient. My brothers need me.
AD_ThrumboVignette_0.context: NodeContext: Quietly, trying to reassure himself

PAD_AlarmDoorRevealed_0.speaker: Player
PAD_AlarmDoorRevealed_0.text: A warded door. Better open it gently.

PAD_DiscoveredMummyLordResearch_0.speaker: Player
PAD_DiscoveredMummyLordResearch_0.text: A jar that grants immortality, hidden inside a zombie. It's almost poetic.

AD_MagicDoor_0.speaker: GROUP_LOW_SorcerousSundries_MagicDoor
AD_MagicDoor_0.context: InternalNodeContext: Is inviting player to "Enter" (just for clarity)NodeContext: Spooky undead drawl

PAD_ReactToJarNoDamage_0.speaker: Player
PAD_ReactToJarNoDamage_0.text: Wasn't expecting that. This jar fights back.

AD_MysticCarrionTaunt_Turn1_0.speaker: Mystic Carrion
AD_MysticCarrionTaunt_Turn1_0.context: NodeContext: Combat AD - active, angry at player

AD_MummyAwakened_002_0.speaker: Ancient Servant
AD_MummyAwakened_002_0.context: NodeContext: Mummy voice - restrained shock at being awoken from coffin. Speaking an unknown language - pronunciation unimportant

PAD_SucceededPerceptionPortrait_0.speaker: Player
PAD_SucceededPerceptionPortrait_0.text: That portrait - it's been warded with necrotic magic.

Ghast_0.speaker: Thenar
Ghast_0.text: Mystic Carrion no more. Thrumbo in charge. Better. Much better.
Ghast_0.context: NodeContext: Appraising the situation, deciding it's a good thing.

Ghast_6.speaker: Thenar
Ghast_6.text: Hush. No noises. Disturbs the spirits.
Ghast_6.context: NodeContext: Urgent - worried about getting in trouble

Ghast_29.speaker: Thenar
Ghast_29.context: NodeContext: Curious but with a threatening undercurrent. Strange phrasing is intentional - meaning is "What are you doing here?"

Ghast_27.speaker: Thenar
Ghast_27.context: NodeContext: Air of recognition - a bit more respectful, now he thinks you're a customer

Ghast_12.speaker: Thenar
Ghast_12.text: Please, valued customer - enter. Mystic Carrion waits below.

Ghast_31.speaker: Thenar
Ghast_31.text: No invitation. No permission. Not expected.
Ghast_31.context: NodeContext: Listing the reasons you can't come in

Ghast_37.speaker: Thenar
Ghast_37.context: NodeContext: Firm, urgent but not yet aggressive

Ghast_4.speaker: Player
Ghast_4.text: Leave? I don't even know where I am!

Ghast_1.speaker: Thenar
Ghast_1.text: In Mystic Carrion's halls. But not allowed. Customers only.

Ghast_32.speaker: Player
Ghast_32.text: Who's Mystic Carrion? He sounds very dramatic.

Ghast_24.speaker: Thenar
Ghast_24.text: Master of death. Spirit weaver. Necromancer.

Ghast_40.speaker: Thenar
Ghast_40.text: Important and rich. Like his clients. Not like you.

Ghast_39.speaker: Thenar
Ghast_39.text: Must leave. Only come by invitation.

Ghast_20.speaker: Player
Ghast_20.text: I've plenty of gold to spare. Can I become a customer?

Ghast_38.speaker: Thenar
Ghast_38.text: Cannot ask for help. Only take, if offered.

Ghast_26.speaker: Thenar
Ghast_26.text: Must leave now. Cannot stay. Forbidden.

Ghast_10.speaker: Player
Ghast_10.text: I'm sure I had an invite here somewhere... Must have dropped the bloody thing.

Ghast_16.speaker: Thenar
Ghast_16.text: Customer always right. Must be kept happy.
Ghast_16.context: NodeContext: Remembering his instructions, obviously something that's beeen drilled into him

Ghast_2.speaker: Thenar
Ghast_2.text: Mystic Carrion waits. In the salon.

Ghast_30.speaker: Thenar
Ghast_30.text: Breaking the rules. Get out. GET OUT.

Ghast_36.speaker: Player
Ghast_36.text: Let me through, or you're the one who'll be going downstairs. Head first.

Ghast_13.speaker: Thenar
Ghast_13.text: No. No pain. Do not hurt.
Ghast_13.context: NodeContext: "There's no need for that" - fearful

Ghast_42.speaker: Player
Ghast_42.text: Do you really get paid enough to worry about who wanders in that door?

Ghast_8.speaker: Thenar
Ghast_8.text: Enter then. Saw nothing. Know nothing.

CoffinMummy_002_0.speaker: Ancient Servant
CoffinMummy_002_0.context: NodeContext: Mummy voice - slow, struggling to form the words - more peaceful tone, giving thanks. Speaking an unknown language - pronunciation unimportant

CoffinMummy_002_1.speaker: Ancient Servant
CoffinMummy_002_1.context: NodeContext: Mummy voice - slow, struggling to form the words. Sense of urgency - a warning. Speaking an unknown language - pronunciation unimportant

CoffinMummy_002_3.speaker: Narrator
CoffinMummy_002_3.text: *The mummy's words set a shiver up your spine. Though she speaks a language lost to the living, her purpose is clear - she is warning you.*

CoffinMummy_002_2.speaker: Ancient Servant
CoffinMummy_002_2.context: NodeContext: Mummy voice - slow, struggling to form the words. Sense of urgency - a warning.Speaking an unknown language - pronunciation unimportant

CoffinMummy_002_4.speaker: Ancient Servant
CoffinMummy_002_4.context: NodeContext: Mummy voice - slow, struggling to form the words - more peaceful tone, giving thanks. Speaking an unknown language - pronunciation unimportant

CoffinMummy_002_5.speaker: Narrator
CoffinMummy_002_5.text: *Though expressed in an ancient tongue, you are able to decipher the mummy's intention. She is trying to thank you.*

PAD_EnteredLarder_0.speaker: Player
PAD_EnteredLarder_0.text: That smell... These corpses aren't the freshest.

FatherCarrion_8.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_8.text: First you butcher my staff, then you dare to enter my salon without an appointment.
FatherCarrion_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mystic Carrion stands still, almost trance-like at his throne. The player approaches, but he does not seem aware of their presence, then - BANG. He slams his staff on the ground.NodeContext: annoyed, but not overly so. A minor inconvenience

FatherCarrion_42.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_42.text: What possible reason could you have to enter the presence of Mystic Carrion?
FatherCarrion_42.context: NodeContext: Powerful/compelling -  a hard to resist instruction

FatherCarrion_6.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_6.text: I'd like to learn what the spirits know about 'The Necromancy of Thay'. [GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

FatherCarrion_187.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_187.text: Hmm. They were... displeased when you refused them. But we may see if they are willing to forgive.

FatherCarrion_31.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_31.text: I'd like to learn what the spirits know about 'The Necromancy of Thay'. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

FatherCarrion_371.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_371.text: I'm trying to help your customer Oskar. He's been possessed.

FatherCarrion_296.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_296.text: That's it? You don't want to punish me for killing everyone upstairs?

FatherCarrion_107.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_107.text: In a city like this, reeking with the desperation of the damned, they are not difficult to replace.

FatherCarrion_29.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_29.text: I am a spirit medium, one capable of bridging the void between the living and the unliving, this plane and the next.
FatherCarrion_29.context: NodeContext: Correcting you, insulted by your question

FatherCarrion_75.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_75.text: You do not possess the aptitude to attempt such a journey. Nor are you the calibre of client I would usually offer to escort.

FatherCarrion_2.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_2.text: You possess some aptitude in that regard, but I'm afraid you aren't of the calibre required to be one of my regular clients.

FatherCarrion_440.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_440.text: How did a medium end up in Baldur's Gate?

FatherCarrion_324.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_324.text: My story has been eternities in the making. Were I to recount it, you would return to dust before I finished the first sentence.

FatherCarrion_272.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_272.text: As for why I chose this place as my home - it is a city rife with anguish, rippling with disturbed spiritual energy.

FatherCarrion_246.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_246.text: The people here required a reassuring hand to navigate such waters, and so I offered mine.

FatherCarrion_273.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_273.text: What kinds of clients do you accept?

FatherCarrion_253.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_253.text: Only a very select few, taken from the highest reaches of society.

FatherCarrion_291.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_291.text: I find them to be far more appreciative of my services than the average mourner. And far more generous in paying for them.

FatherCarrion_235.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_235.text: So you take advantage of the rich and the vulnerable?

FatherCarrion_333.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_333.text: What are a few trinkets on the Material Plane when they could let you converse with a beloved mother? Or grant you vengeance where the justice of this world has faltered?

FatherCarrion_426.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_426.text: I am hardly to blame for the inequalities at play in this city. My price is fair - it is not for I to decide who can afford it.

FatherCarrion_197.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_197.text: You, for instance, cannot. And so I fear we have nothing left to discuss.

FatherCarrion_354.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_354.text: The dead divulge their secrets to me readily enough.

FatherCarrion_17.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_17.text: Is that so? Yes, I see... A brief and superficial incantation, cast by only the crudest of magicians.
FatherCarrion_17.context: NodeContext: At first curious, then snobbish, judging your use of the Speak with Dead spell

FatherCarrion_442.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_442.text: No customer of mine would ever settle for such parlour tricks. Nor would they pay for them.
FatherCarrion_442.context: NodeContext: Snobbish, judging your use of the spell

FatherCarrion_269.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_269.text: If that is the sum of your curiosity, then I'm afraid we have nothing more to discuss. In this life, at least.
FatherCarrion_269.context: NodeContext: Trying to bring the conversation to a close

FatherCarrion_143.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_143.text: Unless, of course, you are looking for a job.

FatherCarrion_111.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_111.text: I came to discuss your client Oskar. He's been possessed.

FatherCarrion_98.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_98.text: The painter. Yes, I remember. He wanted to contact a tormented spirit.
FatherCarrion_98.context: NodeContext: with a smile - reminded of a cruel joke he played

FatherCarrion_16.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_16.text: I gave him exactly what he desired, and for a pittance, given the complexity of his request.

FatherCarrion_192.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_192.text: His inability to follow simple instructions is hardly my fault. If he wanted his safety guaranteed, that would have cost him extra.
FatherCarrion_192.context: NodeContext: shocked that he might be considered to blame

FatherCarrion_233.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_233.text: Who was he trying to contact?

FatherCarrion_391.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_391.text: My clients are guaranteed absolute privacy in their consultations with myself and my spirits.
FatherCarrion_391.context: NodeContext: A point of pride - he would never betray them (slimy)

FatherCarrion_153.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_153.text: How can he be freed of the spirit possessing him?

FatherCarrion_132.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_132.text: It's quite simple. He requires an exorcism.

FatherCarrion_180.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_180.text: His foolishness did not merit such a cruel punishment.

FatherCarrion_276.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_276.text: Idiocy punishes itself. My instructions were clear, as were the consequences of ignoring them.

FatherCarrion_342.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_342.text: My soft heart is to blame. I was too charitable in offering him my services so cheaply. He was clearly not capable.
FatherCarrion_342.context: NodeContext: with a dramatic sigh - woe is me

FatherCarrion_120.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_120.text: So if he were richer, you would have protected him?

FatherCarrion_168.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_168.text: Of course. That's what my clients pay for - to feel safe and superior, even over death itself.

FatherCarrion_206.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_206.text: Oskar couldn't afford one tenth of my usual fees. I was indulgent in helping him, but now the spirit must be exorcised.

FatherCarrion_23.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_23.text: You knew exactly what would happen. You torment him intentionally.

FatherCarrion_205.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_205.text: Had he followed my instructions, he would never have been harmed.

FatherCarrion_55.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_55.text: I assume you came to me seeking an exorcism?

FatherCarrion_435.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_435.text: I can provide you with the means to perform such a ceremony, but you understand, this is my livelihood. First, you must do something for me.

FatherCarrion_19.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_19.text: Can't I just pay you instead?

FatherCarrion_351.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_351.text: So ready to part with your gold to save yourself the bother of helping someone.

FatherCarrion_158.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_158.text: Perhaps you are more like my usual customers than I thought.

FatherCarrion_189.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_189.text: Very well - you may purchase Oskar's salvation. If you can afford it. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_4_5dac5eea-faeb-459c-b675-46c51519b784])
FatherCarrion_189.context: NodeContext: A bit pissed off, but still wants to work with you

FatherCarrion_458.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_458.text: On second thoughts, tell me what you need.

FatherCarrion_299.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_299.text: Do as I have asked. Return Thrumbo's body to me, and I will help your painter friend.

FatherCarrion_240.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_240.text: A fair offer, given the boy only has himself to blame.

FatherCarrion_339.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_339.text: Do not worry - it is of an earthly nature. It regards a conduit of mine, Thrumbo, who has recently deserted his duties.

FatherCarrion_290.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_290.text: He has not gone far, but given the sensitivity of his nature, I would prefer that he is not free to roam the city.

FatherCarrion_380.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_380.text: Return Thrumbo's body to me. Then I will give you what you need to cleanse Oskar of his spectral interloper.

FatherCarrion_210.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_210.text: First, tell me why he ran.

FatherCarrion_346.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_346.text: It's quite simple: he resented having to work for a living. The undead can be rather lazy in that regard.

FatherCarrion_100.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_100.text: He was always a simple, contented creature - a beggar to the bone. Perhaps he has forgotten how ungenerous the world can be, or simply prefers to live in the gutter.

FatherCarrion_110.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_110.text: If he does not value the gift I gave in reanimating that wretched flesh of his, then I will take it back. It is my property, not his.
FatherCarrion_110.context: NodeContext: Callous, indifferent to Thrumbo's death

FatherCarrion_281.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_281.text: I already killed your runaway. Here's his body.

FatherCarrion_99.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_99.text: Your runaway is already dead, but I can give you this jar I found in his body.

FatherCarrion_300.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_300.text: A most prescient guest you are. And of course, such an offering must be repaid in kind.

FatherCarrion_24.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_24.text: Baldur's Gate is a big city. A name's not much to go on.

FatherCarrion_113.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_113.text: Had I thought you were the type to shout his name from the rooftops, I never would have offered you the job.

FatherCarrion_106.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_106.text: Thrumbo is not alone in his ingratitude - he has led others in my service astray. Three of them - beggars and zombies alike.

FatherCarrion_249.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_249.text: The others lack even Thrumbo's modicum of intelligence. It should be no great task to wring his location from one of them.
FatherCarrion_249.context: NodeContext: Dismissive - couldn't care less what happens to the other three

FatherCarrion_254.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_254.text: Very well. I'll bring you Thrumbo. You agree to free Oskar.

FatherCarrion_455.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_455.text: Then, with the spirits herein our witnesses - the arrangement is made.

FatherCarrion_257.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_257.text: Three others escaped with him, though they lack even Thrumbo's modicum of intelligence. They can no doubt point you in his direction.

FatherCarrion_12.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_12.text: They will follow your progress with great interest. As will I.

FatherCarrion_247.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_247.text: I'd rather just pay the gold. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_4_5dac5eea-faeb-459c-b675-46c51519b784])

FatherCarrion_11.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_11.text: Then the Torch of Revocation is yours to use.
FatherCarrion_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player pays the gold, and in return Mystic Carrion hands them the Torch of Revocation

FatherCarrion_416.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_416.text: I hope he is grateful for the price you paid to help him. Generosity like yours should never go unrewarded.
FatherCarrion_416.context: NodeContext: Like he knows something you don't (the spirit you exorcise from Oskar will attack you)

FatherCarrion_216.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_216.text: Your purse is deeper than I thought. But wait -
FatherCarrion_216.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player hands Carrion the gold. After taking the gold, Carrion stops, as though listening to somethign the player cannot hear...NodeContext: Carrion stops after his line, as if listening to something we cannot hear

FatherCarrion_353.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_353.text: Strange. My spirits witnessed thieving hands snatching up the very item I wished to give - the Torch of Revocation.
FatherCarrion_353.context: CinematicNodeContext: Carrion's focus returns to the player, unimpressedNodeContext: Tilts his head and looks at the player, unphased

FatherCarrion_434.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_434.text: As you have paid for your indiscretion, we shall leave the matter at that. Now - get out.
FatherCarrion_434.context: NodeContext: A little pissed off, but still feeling he won the exchange with you

FatherCarrion_167.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_167.text: I need time to think about this.

FatherCarrion_87.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_87.text: A simple errand seems no price at all for the soul of your artist friend.
FatherCarrion_87.context: NodeContext: Feigning confusion - why ever would you refuse?

FatherCarrion_129.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_129.text: Take time to consider my offer, if that is what you require. I'm sure Oskar has plenty to spare.

FatherCarrion_10.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_10.text: Do not think on it too long, lest my offer be rescinded.
FatherCarrion_10.context: NodeContext: A bit pissed off - you wasted his time making him explain this. Now treating you like the help, not a customer

FatherCarrion_348.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_348.text: No way. I'm not getting involved.

FatherCarrion_234.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_234.text: A rash decision - one you will no doubt come to regret.

FatherCarrion_363.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_363.text: When you have the stomach for the work, you are welcome to return.

FatherCarrion_126.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_126.text: I might be able to help. For a fee, of course.

FatherCarrion_115.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_115.text: I am more than able to offer you suitable recompense for such a task.

FatherCarrion_195.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_195.text: An item, perhaps. One that resonates with your spiritual energies. The spirits will help me decide, once the task is performed.
FatherCarrion_195.context: NodeContext: Considering - hasn't yet made his mind up

FatherCarrion_388.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_388.text: First, you must bring me Thrumbo's body.

FatherCarrion_58.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_58.text: You speak of owning Thrumbo - are you his patron?

FatherCarrion_239.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_239.text: I would not form a pact with a creature as base as Thrumbo. He is but a lost tool - one I wish to have returned.

FatherCarrion_70.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_70.text: Absolutely not. I won't help you with this.

FatherCarrion_260.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_260.text: His 'body'? It sounds like you want him killed.

FatherCarrion_448.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_448.text: My child, that would be asking the impossible. He is already dead.

FatherCarrion_384.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_384.text: He is, what do they call them here... ah, a zombie. A waif I rescued from the jaws of death, and gave a second chance at earthly purpose.
FatherCarrion_384.context: NodeContext: At first, racking his brain - trying to recall the term to use in this time and place. Then grandiose.

FatherCarrion_343.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_343.text: I'll need to think about it.

FatherCarrion_449.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_449.text: So you won't just do it out of the goodness of your heart?

FatherCarrion_36.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_36.text: I'm afraid my heart simply isn't in it.

FatherCarrion_320.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_320.text: My professional services are available to you, should you be prepared to do something for me. The choice is entirely yours.

FatherCarrion_436.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_436.text: I'll figure it out for myself.

FatherCarrion_62.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_62.text: Some spiritual materials, though not much within reach of your purse, I fear.

FatherCarrion_225.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_225.text: Is there anything I can do for you?

FatherCarrion_201.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_201.text: Hmmm. Yes, my spirits stir. They think you might be capable.
FatherCarrion_201.context: CinematicNodeContext: Carrion raises one hand to his head, as though channeling spirits. A strange wind whistles through the chamber. The light flickers, as though a presence is making itself known.NodeContext: Considering. Carrion, now standing, raises his staff  and puts his other hand on his temple for concentration.

FatherCarrion_96.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_96.text: Very well. You may help me with a small matter.

FatherCarrion_15.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_15.text: I have an assistant, Thrumbo - a conduit I use to maintain my connections with the Ethereal Plane. Unfortunately, he has deserted his duties.

FatherCarrion_444.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_444.text: Return Thrumbo's body to me, and I will see that you are suitably compensated.

FatherCarrion_25.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_25.text: You must be very selective. I've never heard anyone mention you.

FatherCarrion_142.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_142.text: My name is known to those who matter. So is my discretion.

FatherCarrion_124.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_124.text: The living hold such superstition about communing with the dead. As such, my patrons prefer to use my services in the strictest confidence.

FatherCarrion_188.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_188.text: Whatever the customer desires. Or at least, whatever they can afford.

FatherCarrion_407.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_407.text: Each brings their own desperation. Some crave a word of solace, some wish to see, to summon, to torment - I provide for them all, according to their merit.

FatherCarrion_337.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_337.text: You are not deserving of such a gift. Unless you've some other purpose here, our consultation is at an end.

FatherCarrion_88.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_88.text: Don't worry. I'm not here to interfere.

FatherCarrion_250.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_250.text: My spirits will make sure of it.
FatherCarrion_250.context: NodeContext: warning, but with a smile (not a prelude to combat)

FatherCarrion_65.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_65.text: Halls of kings would hold upon my every honeyed word - what do you know of my calibre?

FatherCarrion_415.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_415.text: However saccharine your words might be, I assure you they aren't to my tastes.

FatherCarrion_161.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_161.text: I am a Ravengard. My lineage is beyond reproach.

FatherCarrion_155.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_155.text: Lineage alone does not earn you the right to my services. I've turned away bluer blood than yours.

FatherCarrion_181.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_181.text: 'Mystic Carrion'? Are you some kind of fortune-teller?

FatherCarrion_395.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_395.context: NodeContext: Pissed off but in control

FatherCarrion_400.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_400.text: What other services do you provide?

FatherCarrion_196.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_196.text: What kind of appointments do you offer?

FatherCarrion_79.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_79.text: That depends on what torments you. Love. Vengeance. Regret.

FatherCarrion_264.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_264.text: The dead can be put to all sorts of purposes, in the hands of one adept at their manipulation.

FatherCarrion_13.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_13.text: I am a spirit medium, one who wanders the hazy boundaries of mortality bearing the intentions of the living, and the knowledge of the dead.
FatherCarrion_13.context: NodeContext: Impressing his importance/power on you, but maintaing a sense of mystery

FatherCarrion_323.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_323.text: A naive interpretation of the forces at work beyond your perception. No wonder you sought a hand like mine to lead you through the darkness.

FatherCarrion_232.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_232.text: What else could you require of Mystic Carrion when he has offered so much already?

FatherCarrion_286.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_286.text: What else could you require of Mystic Carrion when he has given so much already?

FatherCarrion_154.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_154.text: My client list is full. And you are not on it.
FatherCarrion_154.context: NodeContext: Dismissive - not looking for an answer back

FatherCarrion_319.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_319.text: I'd like to hear what the spirits know about 'The Necromancy of Thay'. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

FatherCarrion_350.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_350.text: I'd like to hear what the spirits know about 'The Necromancy of Thay'. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

FatherCarrion_148.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_148.text: I know you helped Oskar. I found your letter.

FatherCarrion_68.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_68.text: I still want to help Oskar. Tell me about the service you require.

FatherCarrion_263.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_263.text: Here's your fee. Tell me how to help Oskar. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_4_5dac5eea-faeb-459c-b675-46c51519b784])

FatherCarrion_447.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_447.text: A small price for the painter's salvation, I'm sure you'll agree.
FatherCarrion_447.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands gold over to Carrion. He receives it. (unseen)

FatherCarrion_123.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_123.text: I came to offer my own services, if you've need of anything.

FatherCarrion_321.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_321.text: Do you have anything to trade?

FatherCarrion_409.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_409.text: Naturally. A few choice items for those seeking contact with the Ethereal planes.

FatherCarrion_271.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_271.text: Feel free to return, so long as you can afford it.

FatherCarrion_417.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_417.text: Hand his carcass to me. Quickly.
FatherCarrion_417.context: CinematicNodeContext: Carrion holds out his hands, expectantNodeContext: Hiding his urgency - he's eager to get back the canopic jar hidden inside. He holds out his hand expectantly

FatherCarrion_372.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_372.text: Thrumbo seemed harmless enough to me.

FatherCarrion_267.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_267.text: What he seemed to you and what he was to me are two entirely unrelated matters.

FatherCarrion_370.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_370.text: I desired him to be returned to me, and you obliged, thus our terms have been met.

FatherCarrion_176.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_176.text: Now - hand me his body. Stop wasting time.
FatherCarrion_176.context: NodeContext: Getting a little more urgent, annoyed that you're stalling.

FatherCarrion_57.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_57.text: I think it's time to renegotiate. I found the jar hidden in Thrumbo's corpse.

FatherCarrion_241.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_241.text: I don't have his body, but will this jar suffice?

FatherCarrion_420.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_420.text: Yes, that will be more than enough. A task most efficiently performed.

FatherCarrion_4.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_4.text: Not so fast. First, tell me about the reward you promised.

FatherCarrion_366.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_366.text: It is a Torch of Revocation, a light used only to illuminate the darkest pathways of the damned.

FatherCarrion_50.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_50.text: Few exist, and fewer still can be obtained for such a meagre price. It is a rare gift - one some in this city desperately require.
FatherCarrion_50.context: NodeContext: Edging towards a threat on the last part of the line

FatherCarrion_0.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_0.text: Give me Thrumbo's flesh, and the Torch is yours.
FatherCarrion_0.context: NodeContext: Stern, not impressed that you're delayig the handover

FatherCarrion_313.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_313.text: So, you choose to deceive me. What you have stolen, I will reclaim. And I will make your soul suffer for it.

FatherCarrion_27.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_27.text: No more than the ungrateful cur deserved.
FatherCarrion_27.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player hands Thrumbo's body to Carrion (unseen). NodeContext: Carrion looks down at the corpse that's been thrown at his feet

FatherCarrion_102.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_102.text: Take the Torch. Put it to whatever use you see fit.
FatherCarrion_102.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mystic Carrion hands over the Torch of Revocation. The player accepts.

FatherCarrion_9.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_9.text: And what do you deserve? You sought the means to help sweet young Oskar, did you not?

FatherCarrion_461.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_461.text: I give you this Torch of Revocation.
FatherCarrion_461.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mystic Carrion hands over the Torch of Revocation. The player accepts.

FatherCarrion_439.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_439.text: And what do you deserve, I wonder, for meting out such justice?

FatherCarrion_45.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_45.text: Yes, of course. A Torch of Revocation. Fitting for one so adept at tracking down wayward souls.
FatherCarrion_45.context: CinematicNodeContext: Carrion listens, as though receiving an answer from a voice we cannot hear. Mystic Carrion hands over the Torch of Revocation. The player accepts.NodeContext: Carrion pauses and listens for a bit, before handing the player a torch

FatherCarrion_28.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_28.text: Is that so? I hear you already stole something of great value from me. And so, you deserve nothing more.
FatherCarrion_28.context: CinematicNodeContext: Carrion tilts his head, as though listening to a voice we cannot hear. His attention returns to the player, unimpressedNodeContext: Pissed off at you, but he got what he wanted so is letting it go. He tilts his head as if listening to a voice we cannot hear, then focuses back on the player

FatherCarrion_152.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_152.text: Is that the going rate for canopic jars these days? I expected more.

FatherCarrion_457.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_457.text: This is your preferred course - to change the terms of our arrangement now that you feel you have the upper hand?
FatherCarrion_457.context: NodeContext: Not impressed, hint of a threat

FatherCarrion_53.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_53.text: You know what, the Torch of Revocation is plenty.

FatherCarrion_302.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_302.text: Gratitude is a lesson some never learn. You were wise not to make me teach you.

FatherCarrion_71.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_71.text: The Torch will be more than enough to free your little painter friend of his unwanted occupier.
FatherCarrion_71.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mystic Carrion hands over the Torch of Revocation. The player accepts.

FatherCarrion_252.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_252.text: Use it to destroy the painting of his self-destructive lover, and her spirit will be forced to vacate his body.
FatherCarrion_252.context: NodeContext: Snappy, businesslike - he wants this conversation to be over

FatherCarrion_74.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_74.text: And what prize do the spirits wish me to offer? Ah, yes. Take the Torch of Revocation. A generous reward for such a menial service.
FatherCarrion_74.context: CinematicNodeContext: Carrion listens, as though receiving an answer from a voice we cannot hear. Mystic Carrion hands over the Torch of Revocation. The player accepts.NodeContext: Carrion pauses and listens for a bit, before handing the player a torch

FatherCarrion_413.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_413.text: With that, my debt to you is settled. Should you need any further consultations, you will, of course, have to pay for them.
FatherCarrion_413.context: NodeContext: Wrapping things up, unapologetic about returning to a mercantile relationship with you

FatherCarrion_231.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_231.text: Not the hand, but the heart. So sweeten the deal, or I'll destroy the jar.

FatherCarrion_182.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_182.text: You are a brave soul, to try and manipulate one who makes the dead dance from his fingertips.
FatherCarrion_182.context: NodeContext: mildly amused - he doesn't really care about being blackmailed, only about getting the jar back

FatherCarrion_136.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_136.text: Given his condition, I am willing to refund Oskar's original fee. But the Torch of Revocation is what you require to help him.
FatherCarrion_136.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mystic Carrion hands over the Torch of Revocation. The player accepts.

FatherCarrion_441.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_441.text: I can offer a small bonus payment, for services so capably rendered. With this and the Torch, my debt is amply paid.
FatherCarrion_441.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mystic Carrion hands over the Torch of Revocation. The player accepts.

FatherCarrion_198.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_198.text: Such a tenacious spirit you possess. I do look forward to meeting it again.

FatherCarrion_344.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_344.text: How disappointing. I hoped Thrumbo's disobedience would die with him.

FatherCarrion_183.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_183.text: Your corpse will surrender the jar to me. I will make it.
FatherCarrion_183.context: NodeContext: Commanding, angered, as though summoning spirits

FatherCarrion_35.context: CinematicNodeContext: The room flickers and whispers around Carrion, as though his spirits are becoming angry. He SLAMS his staff into the ground, unleashing a terrifying scream through the room.

FatherCarrion_202.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_202.text: Your corpse will surrender his flesh to me. I will make it.
FatherCarrion_202.context: NodeContext: Commanding, angered, as though summoning spirits

FatherCarrion_63.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_63.text: Come now - what's a handful of gold when your life is at stake?

FatherCarrion_338.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_338.text: Hmmm... no. Sorry, changed my mind.

FatherCarrion_310.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_310.text: I've decided to keep it. The smell isn't so bad once you get used to it.

FatherCarrion_133.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_133.text: I see you fulfilled our agreement, and with admirable gusto.
FatherCarrion_133.context: CinematicNodeContext: As the player's approach, Carrion raises a hand, as though silencing voices we cannot hear.

FatherCarrion_186.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_186.text: No more than the ungrateful cur deserved.

FatherCarrion_140.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_140.text: You do not have an appointment.
FatherCarrion_140.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mystic Carrion stands still, almost trance-like at his throne. The player approaches, but he does not seem aware of their presence, then - BANG. He slams his staff on the ground.NodeContext: Firm, irritated

FatherCarrion_184.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_184.text: My spirits told me you were capable, yet you stand in my presence, and Thrumbo is nowhere to be seen...

FatherCarrion_22.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_22.text: I came to speak to you about your customer Oskar. He's been possessed.

FatherCarrion_39.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_39.text: Do you have anything to trade?

FatherCarrion_85.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_85.text: But of course. One must never be scared to part with gold - it's better spent than buried.

FatherCarrion_61.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_61.text: I let him go. You'd be wise to do the same.

FatherCarrion_46.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_46.text: So you choose to leave him a vagrant, destined to be swept from the gutters and discarded?

FatherCarrion_358.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_358.text: I gave him safety. I gave him purpose. More than any soul gave him in his mortal lifetime.

FatherCarrion_7.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_7.text: He is bound to me, as I am bound to him. His freedom was never yours to decide.

FatherCarrion_280.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_280.text: What do you mean? What binds you to him?

FatherCarrion_294.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_294.text: Nothing a short-lived creature like yourself would understand.

FatherCarrion_386.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_386.text: His existence is a mere extension of my own - he lives and dies with me.

FatherCarrion_379.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_379.text: You do not get to decide the fates of others. You have earned no such right.

FatherCarrion_117.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_117.text: He can decide his own fate, once I've put you back in the grave for good.

FatherCarrion_423.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_423.text: You think I would die so easily? You think Thrumbo would live? Fool.

FatherCarrion_268.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_268.text: I couldn't care less what happens to him. I'm washing my hands of this rotten business.

FatherCarrion_274.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_274.text: You ignored my instructions, defied me in favour of that half-wit beggar boy.

FatherCarrion_72.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_72.text: Perhaps you will prove more competent once I unshackle your spirit from that useless flesh of yours.

FatherCarrion_212.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_212.text: Some family ties are meant to be broken.

FatherCarrion_165.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_165.text: Foul creature. I will cleanse your stain from this place.

FatherCarrion_282.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_282.text: I've had a change of heart. It's your carcass I'm interested in.

FatherCarrion_94.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_94.text: Is that so? You realise, without me your painter friend hasn't a hope of regaining control of his body.

FatherCarrion_427.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_427.text: You'd condemn Oskar to such a fate, all over the words of a soulless ingrate?

FatherCarrion_381.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_381.text: I don't need you. I'll find another way to help Oskar.

FatherCarrion_289.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_289.text: Had you any concern for Oskar's fate, you'd have helped him already.

FatherCarrion_76.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_76.text: His body is chained to that spirit for eternity. I forged the links myself.
FatherCarrion_76.context: NodeContext: Malicious, gleeful - knew exactly what would happen

FatherCarrion_237.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_237.text: Perhaps you'd care for some bindings of your own. I know plenty of spectres who'd kill to possess a body like yours.
FatherCarrion_237.context: NodeContext: Commanding, angered, as though summoning spirits

FatherCarrion_238.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_238.text: One soul is no great sacrifice to stop someone like you.

FatherCarrion_49.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_49.text: And you believe yourself capable of passing such a judgement?

FatherCarrion_211.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_211.text: It must be a fine thing when one's moral compass points so unwaveringly towards righteousness.

FatherCarrion_91.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_91.text: Let us see if it can guide your spirit through the realms of the dead.

FatherCarrion_456.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_456.text: I've condemned better people over less.

FatherCarrion_78.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_78.text: I know. I've heard them screaming for you.

FatherCarrion_256.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_256.text: So many souls waiting for you to join them. Wanting to hurt. To harm. To have their revenge.

FatherCarrion_200.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_200.text: I think it's time you joined them.

FatherCarrion_44.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_44.text: 'Soulless' is a bold word for an unholy creature like you.

FatherCarrion_138.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_138.text: So quick to brand another as 'unholy'.

FatherCarrion_265.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_265.text: So, Thrumbo's filled your head with tales of woe, and yet still he misses the point entirely. Both of you do.

FatherCarrion_130.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_130.text: Thrumbo is a part of me, and I am part of him. He can no more escape me than a fly can escape the spider's web. He is mine. Forever.

FatherCarrion_304.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_304.text: Terribly sorry but I seem to have, erm, misplaced it.

FatherCarrion_162.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_162.text: I see Thrumbo's idiocy is contagious.

FatherCarrion_316.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_316.text: Hush, spirits - I sense it too. Our guest brings with them the stench of Thrumbo's disobedience.
FatherCarrion_316.context: CinematicNodeContext: As the player's approach, Carrion raises a hand, as though silencing voices we cannot hear.

FatherCarrion_317.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_317.text: A strange offering... yet exactly the one I desired. My spirits did well to whisper my intentions in your ears.
FatherCarrion_317.context: CinematicNodeContext: As the player's approach, Carrion raises a hand, as though silencing voices we cannot hear.

FatherCarrion_378.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_378.text: You have my thanks for bringing Thrumbo back to me.

FatherCarrion_327.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_327.text: You do not have an appointment. Yet you seek an audience with Mystic Carrion...
FatherCarrion_327.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mystic Carrion stands still, almost trance-like at his throne. The player approaches, but he does not seem aware of their presence, then - BANG. He slams his staff on the ground.

FatherCarrion_30.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_30.text: Ah. I sense you have trodden the paths of the dead, felt their bones crumble to dust beneath your feet.
FatherCarrion_30.context: NodeContext: A flash of recognition - he's figured it out

FatherCarrion_430.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_430.text: You are familiar with 'The Necromancy of Thay'.

FatherCarrion_220.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_220.text: Ah, yes. You were drawn to me. A wanderer bearing the scent of death. You are familiar with 'The Necromancy of Thay'.
FatherCarrion_220.context: CinematicNodeContext: Carrion leans forward, curious. NodeContext: Leans forward, curious

FatherCarrion_259.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_259.text: I have heard the spirits whisper its name. Few books have the power to send a shiver through the living and the dead.

FatherCarrion_244.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_244.text: Tell me, what did you make of its contents?

FatherCarrion_454.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_454.text: You're familiar with the subject matter?

FatherCarrion_73.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_73.text: Such a book is for those who make only the shallowest ripples in death's dark pools. I inhabit the depths.

FatherCarrion_398.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_398.text: Still, such powers are not without danger when wielded by one of your... capabilities.
FatherCarrion_398.context: NodeContext: Subtly insulting, 'capabilities' as though he believe you're incapable

FatherCarrion_432.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_432.text: Clearly these are not waters you know how to swim in. I would hate to be the one who helps you drown.
FatherCarrion_432.context: NodeContext: Subtly insulting, 'capabilities' as though he believe you're incapable

FatherCarrion_84.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_84.text: Oh yes, I loved it. Especially the part about the unicorns.

FatherCarrion_95.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_95.text: Those with more... sanguine natures are rarely attuned to the Ethereal Plane, or ready to receive its wisdom -
FatherCarrion_95.context: NodeContext: Subtly insulting, dismissing you as unimportant until the spirits interrupt -

FatherCarrion_355.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_355.text: Ah - but wait. My spirits stir. Our conversation appears to have... disturbed them.
FatherCarrion_355.context: CinematicNodeContext: A strange wind seems to blow through the chamber. The player looks for the cause, but sees nothing. Carrion puts up a hand ('pause/silence' gesture), tilting his head as though listening to something we cannot hear, then speaksNodeContext: Carrion puts up a hand to silence voices, as though hearing someone interrupting (the player hears nothing), and slightly tilts his head

FatherCarrion_159.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_159.text: They have a message for you. A most valuable one. I can summon them forth, if you are willing to offer them suitable recompense. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

FatherCarrion_431.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_431.text: Spirits, Mystic Carrion calls on you. Come forth. Listen. Obey.
FatherCarrion_431.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mystic Carrion raises his staff, putting his other hand to his temple in concentration - he is communing with the spirit realm. The room darkens, the only light a sickly glow over Carrion's form.NodeContext: Carrion, now standing, raises his staff  and puts his other hand on his temple for concentration. Calling out to the room/ghosts. Slightly for the benefit of the player watching him

FatherCarrion_21.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_21.context: CinematicNodeContext: A loud BANG. The player looks into the darkness, but sees nothing there. Carrion has not moved.NodeContext: Quieter, addressed to the player (without physically turning to them)

FatherCarrion_245.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_245.text: Yes. They know of 'The Necromancy of Thay'. They fear it. They do not want its power released -

FatherCarrion_82.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_82.text: Death... destruction... decay... The book must remain sealed.
FatherCarrion_82.context: CinematicNodeContext: Two BANGS. Carrion's head snaps back, as though controlled by something else. He's channelling the spirits.NodeContext: Carrion's head snaps back. he talks as he's possessed. Hisses, as though multiple voices, different ages and genders, are speaking through him. It cuts in and out, as though only part of the message is coming through. he seems controlled by something else as he speaks.

FatherCarrion_352.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_352.text: Fear not, spirits. My interests in the book are purely academic.

FatherCarrion_40.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_40.text: Perhaps... can be trusted... perhaps... this one is different...
FatherCarrion_40.context: CinematicNodeContext: Carrion's staff slides out to the side, as though moved by an unseen hand. He continues to grip it tightly,NodeContext: Channelling. Hissed, as though multiple voices are speaking through him. It cuts in and out, as though only part of the message is coming through

FatherCarrion_223.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_223.context: NodeContext: Channelling. Hissed, as though multiple voices are speaking through him. It cuts in and out, as though only part of the message is coming through

FatherCarrion_203.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_203.text: Seek it... seek it. SEEK IT.
FatherCarrion_203.context: NodeContext: Channelling. Hissed, as though multiple voices are speaking through him. It cuts in and out, as though only part of the message is coming through

FatherCarrion_275.context: CinematicNodeContext: The spirits depart, whistling as though a terrible wind blows through. Then BANG - they are gone, and the atmosphere lifts. Carrion returns to his relaxed pose.

FatherCarrion_108.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_108.text: It seems that if you want to unlock the mysteries of the Necromancy, you must find the 'Tharchiate Codex'.

FatherCarrion_226.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_226.text: A simple ask for such a potent prize.
FatherCarrion_226.context: NodeContext: As though he knows something/is holding something back.

FatherCarrion_230.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_230.text: A necromantic grimoire of some repute, mostly ill.

FatherCarrion_318.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_318.text: The spirits took some persuading. You're sure their advice can be trusted?

FatherCarrion_397.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_397.text: Those who would breach the bounds of life and death must be willing to defy the doctrines of those on both sides.

FatherCarrion_105.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_105.text: The spirits provided you with the knowledge required. That is all that matters.

FatherCarrion_147.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_147.text: If a copy of the 'Tharchiate Codex' has entered this city, it will rest on their shelves.

FatherCarrion_217.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_217.text: Be warned. 'The Necromancy of Thay' is not a book for idle study. I share my spirits' concerns about your aptitude for such knowledge.
FatherCarrion_217.context: NodeContext: An idle warning, not really trying to stop you

FatherCarrion_172.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_172.text: Alas, and further education on the subject would cost far more than you are able to pay.

FatherCarrion_261.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_261.text: Now, unless you have any further business with me - I think this consultation has reached its end.

FatherCarrion_334.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_334.text: I always have items of interest to those of a curious disposition.

FatherCarrion_1.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_1.text: Reading two books? Sounds complicated to me.

FatherCarrion_43.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_43.text: I see you were gifted with the courage to stare into death's darkest corners, but not the intelligence to understand it.

FatherCarrion_144.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_144.text: It does not matter. The magic at work here does not require your comprehension. Only your participation.

FatherCarrion_48.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_48.text: A necromancer's secrets are hard won. There's more to this than a simple codex.

FatherCarrion_336.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_336.text: Collaboration is rarely second nature to your kind. But who knows, the writer of this particular tome may have been feeling generous.

FatherCarrion_151.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_151.text: I might seek out their spirit and ask them. As for you - you must seek the Codex.
FatherCarrion_151.context: NodeContext: With a smile - amused at the thought of the trial awaiting you

FatherCarrion_266.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_266.text: That's what worries me. This seems too easy.

FatherCarrion_359.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_359.text: Perhaps the writer of this tome was a particularly generous necromancer. Or perhaps they had other motives for allowing it to be read so easily.

FatherCarrion_329.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_329.context: CinematicNodeContext: Carrion's staff slides out to the side, as though moved by an unseen hand. He continues to grip it tightly,NodeContext: Channelling. Hissed, as though multiple voices are speaking through him. It cuts in and out, as though only part of the message is coming through

FatherCarrion_361.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_361.text: Leave it be... LEAVE IT BE...
FatherCarrion_361.context: NodeContext: Channelling, gaining in intensity and anger. Hissed, as though multiple voices are speaking through him. It cuts in and out, as though only part of the message is coming through

FatherCarrion_373.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_373.text: The spirits have spoken. 'The Necromancy of Thay' must go unread.
FatherCarrion_373.context: NodeContext: suppressing amusement - after all that, the player didn't get what they wanted

FatherCarrion_387.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_387.text: You must have some idea of how the book can be opened?

FatherCarrion_425.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_425.text: I paid for that consultation. I expected an answer!

FatherCarrion_150.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_150.text: And an answer was provided. The dead are not obliged to provide the one you want.

FatherCarrion_412.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_412.text: There is a place. 'Sorcerous Sundries'. It is the closest to a necromantic emporium this city has to offer.
FatherCarrion_412.context: NodeContext: Slight distaste - it isn't up to his standards

FatherCarrion_32.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_32.text: Go there. Speak with the proprietor. Perhaps they might sell the key to the book's opening.

FatherCarrion_403.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_403.text: So be it. I have no desire to invoke the wrath of the dead.

FatherCarrion_270.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_270.text: Their wrath is one of their finer qualities. A valuable commodity when employed against a mortal enemy, for example.

FatherCarrion_104.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_104.text: Alas, you do not possess the stomach for such practices. Nor could you afford them if you did.

FatherCarrion_325.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_325.text: Still, you may find another purpose for the tome. A doorstop, perhaps.
FatherCarrion_325.context: NodeContext: Smirking - thinks you're an idiot

FatherCarrion_199.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_199.text: Deny me, spectres, and I will unleash such torments you will beg to die again.

FatherCarrion_303.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_303.context: NodeContext: Channelling, fearful. Hissed, as though multiple voices are speaking through him. It cuts in and out, as though only part of the message is coming through

FatherCarrion_360.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_360.text: This knowledge is mine by right. You must obey.

FatherCarrion_221.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_221.text: I hear your warning, spirits. The book shall remain unread.

FatherCarrion_248.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_248.text: We have warned... heed us... never opened... NEVER.
FatherCarrion_248.context: CinematicNodeContext: Carrio's head still snapped back - possession positionNodeContext: Channelling, gaining intensity. head still snaped back. Hissed, as though multiple voices, different ages and genders, are speaking through him. It cuts in and out, as though only part of the message is coming through

FatherCarrion_56.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_56.text: A shame. You could have taken what you needed from them. They are easily controlled.
FatherCarrion_56.context: CinematicNodeContext: Another BANG and the spirits depart. The atmosphere lifts. Carrion returns to his relaxed pose.

FatherCarrion_135.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_135.text: 'Safety' is a concept immaterial to the spectral planes.

FatherCarrion_285.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_285.text: It is sufficient to say - you will not be harmed.

FatherCarrion_298.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_298.text: Let me guess - my dead grandmother wants to tell me she loves me?

FatherCarrion_121.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_121.text: Oh, no. She has forgotten you entirely.

FatherCarrion_228.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_228.text: This message comes from spirits I have collected. Those with great knowledge in life, great wealth, great purpose. It is far more valuable.

FatherCarrion_438.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_438.text: Come now - surely you can offer a better price for one who shares your respect for the dead?

FatherCarrion_392.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_392.context: NodeContext: amused at your haggling, doesn't really respect you

FatherCarrion_357.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_357.text: Very well. A small discount, as a mark of respect for our mutual expertise. Pay, and I will relay their message. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])
FatherCarrion_357.context: NodeContext: amused at your haggling, doesn't really respect you

FatherCarrion_83.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_83.text: Sounds like a waste of gold to me.

FatherCarrion_340.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_340.text: What a plague is the stubbornness of the living. Should you realise your mistake, feel free to return.
FatherCarrion_340.context: NodeContext: unsurprised, never thought you were capable

FatherCarrion_402.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_402.text: Perhaps one day the book will reveal its secrets to you. Until then - they are best left between its covers.

FatherCarrion_277.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_277.text: Unless you have any other business with me, I suggest you return to the domain of the living.

FatherCarrion_134.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_134.text: If I could open it, I'd be glad to share an opinion. Unfortunately, it's shut tight.

FatherCarrion_175.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_175.text: Sealed against those who lack the capability to understand it, no doubt.

FatherCarrion_396.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_396.text: I haven't finished it. Somehow I cannot decipher the final pages.

FatherCarrion_312.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_312.text: Is that so? Then the book's protections must be broken before its true nature can be understood.

FatherCarrion_179.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_179.text: That book tried to kill me. Whatever's inside - it's bad news.

FatherCarrion_14.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_14.text: Few possess the temperament required to gaze into death's abyss. Fewer still to reach in and take from it.

FatherCarrion_401.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_401.text: Have we more business in this life? Can it not wait until the next?
FatherCarrion_401.context: NodeContext: Slightly bored - "why are you still here?"

FatherCarrion_293.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_293.text: What really happened to Oskar's lover?

FatherCarrion_443.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_443.text: Oh, her death was most ordinary.
FatherCarrion_443.context: NodeContext: Couldn't care less about what happpened to her

FatherCarrion_122.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_122.text: She killed herself. Obviously life was too heavy a burden. You'd be surprised how many aren't strong enough to bear it.
FatherCarrion_122.context: NodeContext: Couldn't care less about what happpened to her

FatherCarrion_118.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_118.text: Of course, it was hardly my place to speculate on why she chose such a course. Only her spirit could tell you that.

FatherCarrion_141.speaker: Player
FatherCarrion_141.text: I met your customer Oskar. He's been possessed.

FatherCarrion_177.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_177.context: NodeContext: Knew this would happen, pleased by it

FatherCarrion_322.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_322.text: A simple enough matter to rectify with the Torch of Revocation I gave you.

FatherCarrion_305.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_305.text: After that, you can dispatch the spirit as you see fit. It should be well within your capabilities.
FatherCarrion_305.context: NodeContext: Doesn't really care what happens

FatherCarrion_332.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_332.text: Let it not be said that Mystic Carrion does not take good care of his customers.
