FatherCarrion_190.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_190.text: Ah, I sense you too like to wander the boundaries between life and death. You have read 'The Necromancy of Thay'.

FatherCarrion_376.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_376.text: Tell me, what brings one of such power into the presence of Mystic Carrion?
FatherCarrion_376.context: NodeContext: hint of mockery - the Necromancy of Thay is a children's book, as far as he's concerned

FatherCarrion_422.speaker: Mystic Carrion
FatherCarrion_422.text: If you are unwilling to help me, then I fear we have nothing more to discuss.

AD_LumbarPreBeating_1.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
AD_LumbarPreBeating_1.text: Not a thing. Don't hold back.

ThrumboInsideHouse_4.speaker: Thrumbo
ThrumboInsideHouse_4.text: My kind-hearted friend. What can I do for you?

ThrumboInsideHouse_12.speaker: Thrumbo
ThrumboInsideHouse_12.text: You did it... He's gone... He's really gone...
ThrumboInsideHouse_12.context: NodeContext: Celebrating, as though he can't quite believe it

ThrumboInsideHouse_3.speaker: Thrumbo
ThrumboInsideHouse_3.text: I don't know how to thank you. We can finally be free.

ThrumboInsideHouse_15.speaker: Thrumbo
ThrumboInsideHouse_15.text: Here. Please - take this. I think it's valuable, and I won't need it. Not now Carrion's gone.
ThrumboInsideHouse_15.context: NodeContext: 'I know' as if an idea is occurring to him

ThrumboInsideHouse_14.speaker: Player
ThrumboInsideHouse_14.text: I'm trying to help one of Carrion's customers, Oskar. He's been possessed.

ThrumboInsideHouse_8.speaker: Thrumbo
ThrumboInsideHouse_8.text: I don't know how to do exorcisms yet. But feel free to look through Carrion's records. Perhaps you'll find something of use there.

ThrumboInsideHouse_13.speaker: Player
ThrumboInsideHouse_13.text: Do you have anything to trade?

ThrumboInsideHouse_6.speaker: Thrumbo
ThrumboInsideHouse_6.text: Yes. I think I'll pick up where Carrion left off. A city like this needs a medium.

ThrumboInsideHouse_2.speaker: Thrumbo
ThrumboInsideHouse_2.text: I - I had something for you... I must have dropped it on the way here. Then my thanks will have to do.
ThrumboInsideHouse_2.context: NodeContext: Player already stole ring from Thrumbo, he thinks he's dropped it

ThrumboInsideHouse_7.speaker: Thrumbo
ThrumboInsideHouse_7.text: A poor reward for what you've done for me, but perhaps in Carrion's things you'll find something more worthwhile.
ThrumboInsideHouse_7.context: NodeContext: Apologetic, but encouraging you to explore the house/belongings

PAD_PortraitLetter_0.speaker: Player
PAD_PortraitLetter_0.text: A note, hidden beneath the canvas.

DoorInteraction_5.speaker: Narrator
DoorInteraction_5.text: *Set into the mansion's faded exterior, you see the faintest outline of a door. An entrance designed to provide the utmost discretion.*

DoorInteraction_12.speaker: Narrator
DoorInteraction_12.text: *The door pulses with a heavy, melancholic magic. Whatever lies behind it concerns the living and the dead.*

DoorInteraction_0.speaker: Narrator
DoorInteraction_0.text: *You sense it waits for the right words. It requires permission to open.*

DoorInteraction_7.speaker: Narrator
DoorInteraction_7.text: *The door shudders. It has no choice but to let you inside.*

DoorInteraction_16.speaker: Narrator
DoorInteraction_16.text: *The door does not stir. It will not answer to the cult's demands.*

DoorInteraction_3.speaker: Narrator
DoorInteraction_3.text: *Lord Gortash's name opens many doors, but it does not open this one.*

DoorInteraction_18.speaker: Narrator
DoorInteraction_18.text: *Whatever this door is waiting to hear, it is not the name of some ancient tableware.*

DoorInteraction_20.speaker: Narrator
DoorInteraction_20.text: *Nothing responds within. It is silent as the grave.*

DoorInteraction_9.speaker: Narrator
DoorInteraction_9.text: *Whatever lies behind the door, it guards such secrets closely. It will not reveal them to just anyone.*

Lumbar_2.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
Lumbar_2.text: Back for more? I don't mind, so long as you're paying. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

Lumbar_35.speaker: Narrator
Lumbar_35.text: *You recall where you've smelled this beggar's rotten musk before - in Mystic Carrion's chambers. This is one of his runaway servants.*

Lumbar_8.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
Lumbar_8.text: I told you all I know. Now go and find him, before you get me in trouble.

Lumbar_17.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
Lumbar_17.text: Think Carrion's corpse would make a good punching bag?

Lumbar_21.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
Lumbar_21.text: Find the boats, you'll find Thrumbo. That's all I know!

Lumbar_22.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
Lumbar_22.text: Changed your mind? Offer's still there. Go on - have a swing. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

Lumbar_32.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
Lumbar_32.text: I'll make sure no one harms us again. Keep training, keep fighting.

Lumbar_41.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
Lumbar_41.text: Come to have a go? Give it your best shot.

Lumbar_50.speaker: Narrator
Lumbar_50.text: *An air of decay hangs over the stooped beggar's form, the same that tainted Mystic Carrion's chambers. This is one of his runaway servants.*

Lumbar_30.speaker: Narrator
Lumbar_30.text: *That smell again - fetid flesh and bone. This is another of Mystic Carrion's runaways.*

Lumbar_80.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
Lumbar_80.text: Gold first. Then you can hit me. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

Lumbar_23.speaker: Player
Lumbar_23.text: Isn't this cheating if you're already dead?

Lumbar_81.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
Lumbar_81.text: I'm not dead. Just got a bit of nerve damage. So, you having a go or not? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

Lumbar_75.speaker: Player
Lumbar_75.text: You ran away from Mystic Carrion to do this?

Lumbar_60.speaker: Player
Lumbar_60.text: I'm looking for Thrumbo. Mystic Carrion wants him home.

Lumbar_31.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
Lumbar_31.text: Don't think about trying anything. I'll fight back.
Lumbar_31.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raises his fists, nervous but ready for a fightNodeContext: Shouted to friends in the distance

Lumbar_14.speaker: Player
Lumbar_14.text: Relax, the boss just wanted to give you and Thrumbo a proper send off. Does you need anything?

Lumbar_53.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
Lumbar_53.text: He did? I suppose, I mean - really?
Lumbar_53.context: CinematicNodeContext: Relaxing from fists up pose into normal standing stanceNodeContext: Utter disbelief

Lumbar_54.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
Lumbar_54.text: No chance. I'm not telling you a thing.

Lumbar_25.speaker: Player
Lumbar_25.text: Carrion means Thrumbo no harm. He sent me with provisions for his journey.

Lumbar_34.speaker: Player
Lumbar_34.text: Unless you want me to purge this realm of you and your undead brothers, you'll talk.

Lumbar_15.speaker: Player
Lumbar_15.text: Either you tell me where Thrumbo is, or I drive my fist through your skull.

Lumbar_28.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
Lumbar_28.text: Bloody hells. And I thought Carrion was a bastard.
Lumbar_28.context: CinematicNodeContext: Going from his fists up pose to flinching, then relaxing into a regular standing postureNodeContext: Shocked at how violent the threat was, almost impressed

Lumbar_38.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
Lumbar_38.text: Thrumbo was going to get us a boat. But I haven't heard from him since.
Lumbar_38.context: NodeContext: Struggling to remember, hard to tell if he's making a joke at his own (zombie) expense

Lumbar_44.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
Lumbar_44.text: He must be somewhere near the water. I just hope he didn't drown.

Lumbar_37.speaker: Player
Lumbar_37.text: Tell me where Thrumbo is, and it'll be like we never met.

Lumbar_71.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
Lumbar_71.text: I suppose that's all right. Thrumbo's more of a talker than I am.
Lumbar_71.context: CinematicNodeContext: Relaxing from fists up pose into normal standing stance

Lumbar_82.speaker: Player
Lumbar_82.text: A strange way to earn your keep. Do many take you up on this?

Lumbar_52.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
Lumbar_52.text: Plenty. Lots of angry people in this city. No one else to take it out on.

Lumbar_3.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
Lumbar_3.text: Go on. You seem like you've something pent up.

Lumbar_67.speaker: Player
Lumbar_67.text: That's a cheap price for allowing someone to beat you up.

Lumbar_56.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
Lumbar_56.text: Charge too much, people hit you harder. Then they take the gold back.

Lumbar_77.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
Lumbar_77.text: Besides, I've taken enough punches for free. Least this way I get paid something.
Lumbar_77.context: NodeContext: Small laugh - not clear if he's joking, 'something' as in it's not nothing

Lumbar_18.speaker: Player
Lumbar_18.text: Usually people pay me not to hit them.

Lumbar_43.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
Lumbar_43.text: Tried that once. They took the gold and hit me anyway.

Lumbar_62.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
Lumbar_62.text: Better this way. I still leave with gold in my pocket.

Lumbar_66.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
Lumbar_66.text: So, you having a go or not?

Lumbar_42.speaker: Player
Lumbar_42.text: Of course I'm not going to hit you.

Lumbar_64.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
Lumbar_64.text: Then move. Let someone else have a go.

Lumbar_26.speaker: Player
Lumbar_26.text: I can't afford it. How about giving me a free trial?

Lumbar_36.speaker: Player
Lumbar_36.text: Look closer. Try to identify the cause of the smell.

Lumbar_40.speaker: Player
Lumbar_40.text: I hit very fast. Are you sure you're up to it?

Lumbar_20.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
Lumbar_20.text: S'not a flat fee - you pay per punch, mate. Faster you hit, faster I make coin.

Lumbar_61.speaker: Player
Lumbar_61.text: Sniff the area, expanding your senses. Try to identify the smell.

Lumbar_12.speaker: Narrator
Lumbar_12.text: *Your divine power focuses on the beggar - revealing the magic that sustains him. This man is a corpse - a zombie.*

Lumbar_7.speaker: Narrator
Lumbar_7.text: *Beneath his ragged clothing, you catch a glimpse of rotten flesh - more than any living being could sustain. This man is a zombie.*

Lumbar_10.speaker: Narrator
Lumbar_10.text: *You try to focus on the beggar, but the smell is too strong, too nauseating. Perhaps the cause is better left unknown.*

Lumbar_65.speaker: Player
Lumbar_65.text: The divine tugs at you. Give in, letting your god flow through you.

Lumbar_4.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
Lumbar_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shouted out towards his zombie brothers (not nearby, unseen)NodeContext: Shouted to friends in the distance

Lumbar_68.speaker: Narrator
Lumbar_68.text: *That smell again - fetid flesh and bone. This is another zombie.*

Lumbar_58.speaker: Narrator
Lumbar_58.text: *An air of decay hangs over the stooped beggar's form. The smell of rot. The smell of death.*

Lumbar_51.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
Lumbar_51.text: Thrumbo said you saved us, so thanks, I guess. Doesn't mean you don't need some sense knocking into you.
Lumbar_51.context: NodeContext: Grumpy/surly - he was pissed off at you but is reluctantly getting over it

Lumbar_70.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
Lumbar_70.text: Go away. I'm not telling you squat.

CoffinMummy_001_0.speaker: Ancient Servant
CoffinMummy_001_0.context: NodeContext: As though struggling to form the words - happy that they can live in the house in peace

CoffinMummy_001_1.speaker: Ancient Servant
CoffinMummy_001_1.context: NodeContext: As though struggling to form the words

CoffinMummy_001_2.speaker: Ancient Servant
CoffinMummy_001_2.context: NodeContext: As though struggling to form the words

CoffinMummy_001_3.speaker: Ancient Servant
CoffinMummy_001_3.context: NodeContext: As though struggling to form the words - happy that they can live in the house in peace

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_3.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_3.text: 'Down the stairs, across the sand. Down the stairs, across the sand...'

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_6.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_6.text: Sister was always good at hiding. But I'll find her this time.

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_30.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_30.text: Will Thrumbo come and play with me soon?

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_35.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_35.text: You aren't very nice. But I am. So you can stay.
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_35.context: NodeContext: A child who's been told to play nicely

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_48.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_48.text: I will get a bedroom of my own now. I can keep lovely things in it, for when sister can visit.

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_52.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_52.text: Sister was always good at hiding. But I'll find her this time.

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_59.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_59.text: Brother Thrumbo said you saved us. You are welcome to play here any time.

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_10.speaker: Narrator
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_10.text: *You recall where you've smelled this beggar's rotten musk before - in Mystic Carrion's chambers. This is one of the runaways he seeks.*

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_76.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_76.text: Come out, sister - I will find you!
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_76.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morbus calls out to his sister (not present - he's actually standing near her grave)NodeContext: Playful, calling out as though playing hide and seek

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_49.speaker: Narrator
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_49.text: *An air of decay hangs over the stooped beggar's form, the same that tainted Mystic Carrion's chambers. This is one of his runaway servants.*

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_0.speaker: Narrator
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_0.text: *That smell again - fetid flesh and bone. This is another of Mystic Carrion's runaways.*

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_68.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_68.text: Sister always hides from me. She likes to play.
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_68.context: NodeContext: Explaining to the player, as if they asked

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_67.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_67.text: Is your sister a zombie, too?

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_83.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_83.text: A zombie? Are you playing with me?
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_83.context: NodeContext: Not lying to you. He genuinely believes this is part of a game

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_29.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_29.text: When I find sister, I will ask her if you can join our game. She's the oldest.
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_29.context: NodeContext: 'She's the oldest' as though this explains why it isn't his decision.

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_69.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_69.text: Mystic Carrion is looking for you. He sent me.

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_64.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_64.text: No, not him. He isn't allowed to play. Thrumbo said he can't find us.

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_38.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_38.text: Thrumbo said not - not to tell anyone where we went...
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_38.context: NodeContext: Very uncertain - naturally trusting, so this instruction is hard for him to understand

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_42.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_42.text: We're playing Rivington rules, remember? Which means Thrumbo won, and I have to go congratulate him.

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_14.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_14.text: It's too late for that. I already caught you. The game's over.

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_12.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_12.text: You were playing, too? You must be nice, like Thrumbo.
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_12.context: NodeContext: Absolutely believes you, a bit dissapointed but will be over it by the next line

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_4.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_4.text: No, no. You're cheating! I have to hide!

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_70.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_70.text: Thrumbo's not here to protect you, is he? So tell me. NOW!

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_60.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_60.text: Undead defy the natural order - tell me, or I'll correct the mistake that is your existence.

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_78.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_78.text: I don't know! He explained, but I didn't understand...

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_16.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_16.text: 'Down the stairs, across the sand. Down the stairs, across the sand.'
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_16.context: NodeContext: Repeating something he's worked very hard to memorise, stressed out by being put under pressure

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_19.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_19.text: I don't like this game. Leave me alone!
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_19.context: NodeContext: Scared, panicking - about to run away

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_32.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_32.text: You poor creature. I'll not hurt your friend - I swear on all I hold sacred.

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_63.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_63.text: I'll not hurt Thrumbo - I swear it. You can trust me.

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_15.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_15.text: Come now - we're friends, aren't we? You can trust me.

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_7.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_7.text: I can? That's good, because I like you. You're nice, like Thrumbo.
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_7.context: NodeContext: Utterly trusting of the player, really sweet

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_46.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_46.text: He told me what to do, but he said it very quickly. I didn't understand.

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_18.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_18.text: All I remember is, 'Down the stairs, across the sand. Down the stairs, across the sand.'
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_18.context: NodeContext: 'Down the stairs, across the sand' with a sing-song rhythm/tune - it's a memory aid, supposed to have helped him escape.

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_21.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_21.text: Very sensible. Don't tell anyone anything.

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_58.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_58.text: I won't! I'll hide where no one will find me.

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_79.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_79.text: I'm playing hide and seek with Thrumbo. Can you help me find him?

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_44.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_44.text: You're a bit old for hide and seek, aren't you?

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_53.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_53.text: Sister is older than me. She always likes to play.

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_2.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_2.text: She hides in the ground, but I will find her.
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_2.context: NodeContext: No awareness that this means they are dead. Playful, almost gleeful - thinks he's about to win.

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_61.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_61.text: Do you know where she's hiding?

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_25.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_25.text: Some people covered her in dirt. But I will find her again.
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_25.context: NodeContext: Playful, like he knows a secret

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_33.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_33.text: Have you no one else? No other family?

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_23.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_23.text: Mother and father hide in the ground with her.

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_41.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_41.text: I hope I find them soon. I like this game, but it is less fun to play it alone.
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_41.context: NodeContext: Aware of his sadness, but not quite able to realise that they aren't coming back.

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_36.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_36.text: I'm sorry, but your sister is gone. Best let her rest in peace.

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_37.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_37.text: I can't leave her out here alone.

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_85.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_85.text: Sister is always happy to see me - she told me so. She will smile so much when I find her.
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_85.context: NodeContext: Happy in thoughts of his sister

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_54.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_54.text: Your sister is no more - her soul has left this plane. Do you understand?

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_81.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_81.text: Your sister is no more - her soul has left this plane. If you like, we could pray for her?

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_55.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_55.text: Your sister is food for the worms, and her soul twists in agony as we speak. She's dead.

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_45.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_45.text: If she's in the ground, that means she's dead.

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_5.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_5.text: No... no, she is just good at keeping still.

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_50.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_50.text: She is the best at this game. I never win, except when she lets me.
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_50.context: NodeContext: Proud of his sister's skills, not bothered that she lets him win - it makes him love here even more

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_28.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_28.text: If I were her, I'd be hiding, too. You smell terrible up close.

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_20.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_20.text: NO. I am clean. I take good care of myself, like sister taught me.

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_8.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_8.text: Sister might need a wash though. She is hiding from me, in the ground over there.

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_47.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_47.text: Look closer. Try to identify the cause of the smell.

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_84.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_84.text: Sniff the area, expanding your senses. Try to identify the smell.

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_9.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_9.text: The divine tugs at you. Give in, letting your god flow through you.

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_11.speaker: Narrator
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_11.text: *Your divine power focuses on the beggar - revealing the magic that sustains him. This man is a corpse - a zombie.*

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_31.speaker: Narrator
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_31.text: *Beneath his ragged clothing, you catch a glimpse of rotten flesh - more than any living being could sustain. This man is a zombie.*

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_56.speaker: Narrator
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_56.text: *You try to focus on the beggar, but the smell is too strong, too nauseating. Perhaps the cause is better left unknown.*

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_17.speaker: Narrator
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_17.text: *That smell again - fetid flesh and bone. This is another zombie.*

ZombieBeggar_Morbus_57.speaker: Narrator
ZombieBeggar_Morbus_57.text: *An air of decay hangs over the stooped beggar's form. The smell of rot. The smell of death.*

LumbarAttacker_0.speaker: 'Logs' Odoolan
LumbarAttacker_0.text: What? It's not good to bottle things up.
LumbarAttacker_0.context: NodeContext: Defending himself, perhaps a bit guilty

LumbarAttacker_1.speaker: 'Logs' Odoolan
LumbarAttacker_1.text: I paid him, fair and square. Everyone's happy. So keep your nose out.
LumbarAttacker_1.context: NodeContext: Defending himself, perhaps a bit guilty

PAD_AncientLairTablet_001_0.speaker: Player
PAD_AncientLairTablet_001_0.text: 'Those who draw breath, embrace death.' An instruction these corpses took literally.

AD_FatherCarrionAttacked_0.speaker: Mystic Carrion
AD_FatherCarrionAttacked_0.text: You will suffer for your stupidity.
AD_FatherCarrionAttacked_0.context: NodeContext: Combat line, seething with anger

AD_FatherCarrionAttacked_1.speaker: Mystic Carrion
AD_FatherCarrionAttacked_1.text: I am free of death's shackles. You will wear them for eternity.
AD_FatherCarrionAttacked_1.context: NodeContext: Combat line, confident anger at the player

AD_FatherCarrionAttacked_2.speaker: Mystic Carrion
AD_FatherCarrionAttacked_2.text: Thrumbo's blood is on your hands. And yours will be on mine.

AD_FatherCarrionAttacked_3.speaker: Mystic Carrion
AD_FatherCarrionAttacked_3.text: Delinquent fool. Allow me to re-educate you.

AngryFatherCarrion_21.speaker: Mystic Carrion
AngryFatherCarrion_21.text: I confess, I am beginning to find you similarly tiresome.

AngryFatherCarrion_3.speaker: Mystic Carrion
AngryFatherCarrion_3.text: Thief. Vandal. Idiot. Destroying the jar means nothing so long as I am here to punish you for it.

AngryFatherCarrion_13.speaker: Mystic Carrion
AngryFatherCarrion_13.text: I will erase your spirit from existence.
AngryFatherCarrion_13.context: NodeContext: Hissed, furious - leading to combat

AngryFatherCarrion_6.speaker: Mystic Carrion
AngryFatherCarrion_6.text: So. Rather than doing as you were told, you engaged in an act of wanton vandalism.

AngryFatherCarrion_1.speaker: Mystic Carrion
AngryFatherCarrion_1.text: I expected better. I thought I made clear the terms of our arrangement.

AngryFatherCarrion_7.speaker: Mystic Carrion
AngryFatherCarrion_7.text: You think my immortality so easily destroyed? What you have done can be undone, though you will not live to see it.

AngryFatherCarrion_17.speaker: Mystic Carrion
AngryFatherCarrion_17.text: Perhaps a few centuries of servitude will enlighten you to the benefits of honouring your agreements.

AngryFatherCarrion_8.speaker: Mystic Carrion
AngryFatherCarrion_8.text: See, spirits, how my killer walks into this salon with such brazen indifference.

AngryFatherCarrion_11.speaker: Mystic Carrion
AngryFatherCarrion_11.text: You are fortunate my death was only a temporary condition. Shall we see if the same goes for you?

AngryFatherCarrion_9.speaker: Mystic Carrion
AngryFatherCarrion_9.text: Thief. None steal from Mystic Carrion and live to take another breath.

AngryFatherCarrion_10.speaker: Mystic Carrion
AngryFatherCarrion_10.text: Still you do not see. You do not understand.

AngryFatherCarrion_5.speaker: Mystic Carrion
AngryFatherCarrion_5.text: Flesh and blood bind me to this plane. I will return. I will always return.

AngryFatherCarrion_14.speaker: Mystic Carrion
AngryFatherCarrion_14.text: You destroyed something very precious of mine, and now you dare to seek an audience with me?

AngryFatherCarrion_2.speaker: Mystic Carrion
AngryFatherCarrion_2.context: NodeContext: Hissed, angry - leading into combat

AngryFatherCarrion_15.speaker: Mystic Carrion
AngryFatherCarrion_15.text: Did you think you could destroy my property without consequence?

AngryFatherCarrion_12.speaker: Mystic Carrion
AngryFatherCarrion_12.text: I will purge you from this plane. And I promise - you will never reach the next.

AngryFatherCarrion_16.speaker: Mystic Carrion
AngryFatherCarrion_16.text: Foolish creature. You thought killing me once would be enough?

AngryFatherCarrion_22.speaker: Mystic Carrion
AngryFatherCarrion_22.text: It was enough to seal Thrumbo's fate. I destroyed him at dawn.

AngryFatherCarrion_4.speaker: Mystic Carrion
AngryFatherCarrion_4.text: His spirit screams within these walls now. I think it's time you joined him.
AngryFatherCarrion_4.context: NodeContext: Amused by the torment he's put Thrumbo through, then threatening - leading into combat

AngryFatherCarrion_18.speaker: Mystic Carrion
AngryFatherCarrion_18.text: Death will not banish me from this plane. Neither will you.

AngryFatherCarrion_19.speaker: Mystic Carrion
AngryFatherCarrion_19.text: So, you destroy my canopic jars, then dare to seek an audience with me?

PAD_BasementBookFound_0.speaker: Player
PAD_BasementBookFound_0.text: A secret lair in the undercity ruins. What was Carrion doing there?
PAD_BasementBookFound_0.context: NodeContext: Just learned this information, curious about it

PAD_CarrionKilledReaction_0.speaker: Player
PAD_CarrionKilledReaction_0.text: Mystic Carrion is truly banished. He will not trouble this plane again.

PAD_CarrionKilledReaction_1.speaker: Player
PAD_CarrionKilledReaction_1.text: Carrion's presence lingers here. He will return, unless his ties to this plane are severed.

PAD_CarrionKilledReaction_2.speaker: Player
PAD_CarrionKilledReaction_2.context: NodeContext: Gale: Scoffing at Mystic Carrion's dramatic choice of name

AD_MorbusAndGirl_1.speaker: Pookums
AD_MorbusAndGirl_1.text: You're not allowed to play here! It's not respectful.
AD_MorbusAndGirl_1.context: NodeContext: Annoying kid, acting grown up, 'respectful' like its a new word they just learned

AD_MorbusAndGirl_0.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
AD_MorbusAndGirl_0.text: We must play here. This is where they like to hide.
AD_MorbusAndGirl_0.context: NodeContext: Patient, slow - not rising to the girl's behaviour

AD_MorbusAndGirl_3.speaker: Pookums
AD_MorbusAndGirl_3.text: But it's not allowed. Why are you being stupid?
AD_MorbusAndGirl_3.context: NodeContext: Annoying kid, acting grown up

AD_MorbusAndGirl_2.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
AD_MorbusAndGirl_2.text: Is this part of the game?
AD_MorbusAndGirl_2.context: NodeContext: Patient, slow - not rising to the girl's behaviour

AD_MorbusAndGirl_4.speaker: Pookums
AD_MorbusAndGirl_4.text: You're going to be in so much trouble.
AD_MorbusAndGirl_4.context: NodeContext: Annoying kid, acting grown up

CoffinMummy_003_0.speaker: Ancient Servant
CoffinMummy_003_0.context: NodeContext: Mummy voice - harsh, but trying to sound softer

CoffinMummy_003_3.speaker: Ancient Servant
CoffinMummy_003_3.context: NodeContext: Mummy voice - harsh, but trying to sound softer

AD_LumbarReactionAfterPunch_0.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
AD_LumbarReactionAfterPunch_0.text: You don't pull your punches, do you?
AD_LumbarReactionAfterPunch_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player punches the beggar hard in the chest. He staggers with the impact, but remains standing and apparently unharmed. (Bronze anims)

AD_LumbarReactionAfterPunch_1.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
AD_LumbarReactionAfterPunch_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player punches the beggar hard in the chest. He staggers with the impact, but remains standing and apparently unharmed. (Bronze anims)NodeContext: Impressed

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_18.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_18.text: A toast to your kindness! And to Carrion rotting in his grave!

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_20.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_20.text: So, you came through for us in the end. Bravo!

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_29.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_29.text: Yes. Um, alms for the poor?
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Puts out his hands in a begging gestureNodeContext: Nervous, putting on his best begging voice.

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_85.speaker: Narrator
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_85.text: *That smell again - fetid flesh and bone. This is another of Mystic Carrion's runaways.*

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_69.speaker: Narrator
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_69.text: *That smell again - fetid flesh and bone. This is another zombie.*

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_0.speaker: Narrator
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_0.text: *An air of decay hangs over the stooped beggar's form, the same that tainted Mystic Carrion's chambers. This is one of his runaway servants.*

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_19.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_19.text: Anything you can spare for a humble beggar?

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_71.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_71.text: I didn't know zombies liked their fruit and vegetables?

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_59.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_59.text: A zombie? Oh no - a touch of scurvy, that's all. Nothing a basket of fruit wouldn't solve, could I afford one...
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_59.context: NodeContext: Nervous lies, leading into a new, subtler appeal for money

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_34.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_34.text: Have you seen Thrumbo? Mystic Carrion is looking for him.

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_15.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_15.context: NodeContext: Horrified - he's been caught out

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_55.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_55.text: Afraid I can't help you. I've lost track of him myself. Took a wrong turn somewhere and poof, he was gone.

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_2.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_2.text: And that's the truth. I never lie.

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_49.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_49.text: You're protecting your friend, I understand. But you can trust me - I promise.

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_13.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_13.text: You do seem the honest type. I can always tell.

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_9.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_9.text: Thrumbo had a plan. He was going to find us an abandoned house, somewhere to hide away from Carrion.

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_8.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_8.text: But I haven't heard from him since. Lots of empty houses to check, you see.

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_57.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_57.text: You have to search them thoroughly. Especially the wardrobes - Thrumbo said that's the smartest place to hide.
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_57.context: NodeContext: Justifying himself, not realising this is valuable information

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_45.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_45.text: No, no I don't think so. My lips are sealed.

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_65.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_65.text: This is important. I need to find your friend - someone's life is at stake.

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_11.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_11.text: Tell me, or spend the rest of your miserable existence waiting for my knife to slit your throat.

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_91.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_91.text: Ah. So that's how it is? Very well.
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_91.context: NodeContext: Clearing his throat, trying to sound confident dealing with you

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_46.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_46.text: I've hunted monsters, beggar. And I won't hesitate to make you my next kill.

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_28.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_28.text: I'll crush your bones to dust, beggar - tell me what you know.

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_35.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_35.text: You'll lose your head in a minute unless you tell me what you know.

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_44.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_44.text: I've heard more than one confession in my time. Tell me what you know - it'll lighten the load.

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_21.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_21.text: You words say one thing, your face another. I see your lies, so let us dispense with them.

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_74.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_74.text: Tell me what you remember, and I might be able to find him for you.

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_16.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_16.text: Would a donation to your escape fund reassure you? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_32.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_32.text: Yes, amazing. It's all coming back to me.
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_32.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands gold to Sacrum (unseen)

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_1.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_1.text: Glad we could get that all straightened out.
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_1.context: NodeContext: Relieved this is going no further

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_78.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_78.text: Cut the act. Tell me where Thrumbo is hiding.

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_80.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_80.text: Thrumbo is dead. I killed him.

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_22.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_22.text: You - you did? Why did you do that, you vicious creature?

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_23.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_23.text: An ear, if you're willing to tell me your tale. How did you end up here?

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_6.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_6.text: That devil, drink! I spent it all.
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_6.context: NodeContext: Mournful, lamenting - a tad overdramatic

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_52.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_52.text: All behind me, of course. Now I only require the gold for, ah, sustenance.
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_52.context: NodeContext: Realises he's given away too much, collecting himself

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_90.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_90.text: An ear, if you're willing to tell me your tale. How did you end up here?

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_7.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_7.text: I will see that it is put to good use. A crate of apples perhaps, or a bottle of wine...

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_79.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_79.text: Give generously. The man is clearly in desperate need. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_39.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_39.text: Give generously. The man is clearly in desperate need. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_33.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_33.text: You'd really give so much? Thank you.

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_24.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_24.text: My brothers will be most surprised. I usually return with empty pockets.

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_67.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_67.text: I'm sorry, my purse is rather light at present.

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_66.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_66.text: I'm sorry, I've nothing to spare.

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_81.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_81.text: Times are hard for us all. But we must persevere!
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_81.context: NodeContext: Trying to make the player feel better

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_48.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_48.text: My brothers are depending on me.
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_48.context: NodeContext: Proud of the responsibility he's been given

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_25.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_25.text: Earn your keep, beggar. The rest of us have to.

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_50.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_50.text: I am trying! But people haven't the gold to spare, it seems.
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_50.context: NodeContext: Doesn't want to believe people are so selfish as to not help him

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_26.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_26.text: People were more generous in days gone by.
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_26.context: NodeContext: Saddened, recalling his previous life

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_75.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_75.text: Earn your keep, beggar. The rest of us have to.

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_43.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_43.text: Look closer. See what truly ails this pungent beggar.

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_30.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_30.text: Sniff the area, expanding your senses. Try to identify the smell.

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_64.speaker: Narrator
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_64.text: *Your divine power focuses on the beggar - revealing the magic that sustains him. This man is a corpse - a zombie.*

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_63.speaker: Narrator
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_63.text: *Beneath his ragged clothing, you catch a glimpse of rotten flesh - more than any living being could sustain. This man is a zombie.*

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_73.speaker: Narrator
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_73.text: *You try to focus on the beggar, but the smell is too strong, too nauseating. Perhaps the cause is better left unknown.*

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_31.speaker: Player
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_31.text: The divine tugs at you. Give in, letting your god flow through you.

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_56.speaker: Narrator
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_56.text: *An air of decay hangs over the stooped beggar's form. The smell of rot. The smell of death.*

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_37.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_37.text: I hope wherever Thrumbo's hiding, he's comfortable. Nothing worse than a tight squeeze.

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_86.speaker: Narrator
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_86.text: *You recall where you've smelled this beggar's rotten musk before - in Mystic Carrion's chambers. This is one of the runaways he seeks.*

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_38.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_38.text: Anything you can lend will be most gratefully received.

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_54.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_54.text: My thanks to you - your gold will be most gratefully spent.
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_54.context: NodeContext: Gracious, overly fawning - hiding nerves

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_70.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_70.text: I'm afraid I've nothing more to tell you. Don't forget to check under the bed!

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_83.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_83.text: Can't a man earn some gold in peace?

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_84.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_84.text: A home at last - this calls for a toast! Now where did that old miser keep the wine?

ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_89.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_89.text: Spare a coin for a lost soul?
ZombieBeggar_Sacrum_89.context: NodeContext: Nervous, putting on his best begging voice.

DeadAdventurer_Dead_20.speaker: Narrator
DeadAdventurer_Dead_20.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

DeadAdventurer_Dead_19.speaker: Dead Half-Elf
DeadAdventurer_Dead_19.text: Beggar... vagrant... scum... my name was Taron...

DeadAdventurer_Dead_27.speaker: Dead Half-Elf
DeadAdventurer_Dead_27.text: Tumbledown... long ago... no home now...

DeadAdventurer_Dead_25.speaker: Dead Half-Elf
DeadAdventurer_Dead_25.text: Carrion... offered shelter... safety... I was desperate...

DeadAdventurer_Dead_15.speaker: Player
DeadAdventurer_Dead_15.text: What do you know about Mystic Carrion?

DeadAdventurer_Dead_2.speaker: Dead Half-Elf
DeadAdventurer_Dead_2.text: Promised... better life... given only death...

DeadAdventurer_Dead_0.speaker: Player
DeadAdventurer_Dead_0.text: What did Carrion do to you?

DeadAdventurer_Dead_12.speaker: Dead Half-Elf
DeadAdventurer_Dead_12.text: Bled... hollowed... emptied... alive... was still alive...

DeadAdventurer_Dead_23.speaker: Player
DeadAdventurer_Dead_23.text: Why didn't he kill you straight away?

DeadAdventurer_Dead_9.speaker: Dead Half-Elf
DeadAdventurer_Dead_9.text: A ritual... jars... hidden in flesh...

DeadAdventurer_Dead_26.speaker: Narrator
DeadAdventurer_Dead_26.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

CoffinMummy_000_0.speaker: Ancient Servant
CoffinMummy_000_0.context: NodeContext: Mummy groan - pleased, sense of finality

CoffinMummy_000_1.speaker: Ancient Servant
CoffinMummy_000_1.context: NodeContext: Mummy groans - lethargic, disturbed from sleep

CoffinMummy_000_2.speaker: Ancient Servant
CoffinMummy_000_2.context: NodeContext: Mummy groans - grumpy, more abrupt tone

PAD_FirstJarGrabbed_0.speaker: Player
PAD_FirstJarGrabbed_0.text: This jar... it feels like death itself. A sure sign of necromancy at work.

AD_MummyAwakened_000_0.speaker: Ancient Servant
AD_MummyAwakened_000_0.context: NodeContext: Mummy groan - annoyed at being woken

AD_AlarmDoor_0.speaker: 7ba14a70-ae26-42fd-81dd-cee4d18479dd
AD_AlarmDoor_0.text: *RING RING RING RING RING RING RING RING!*

AD_MysticCarrionTaunt_Turn2_0.speaker: Mystic Carrion
AD_MysticCarrionTaunt_Turn2_0.text: Death is just the beginning. You will suffer for eternity.

AD_SacrumVignette_2.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
AD_SacrumVignette_2.text: Just one gold piece, that's all I ask.

AD_SacrumVignette_3.speaker: Cecee Gaborr
AD_SacrumVignette_3.text: I'm sorry. I can't help you.
AD_SacrumVignette_3.context: NodeContext: Stern but not trying to be horrible

AD_SacrumVignette_1.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
AD_SacrumVignette_1.text: Some vittals then? Or a small glass of wine?

AD_SacrumVignette_0.speaker: Cecee Gaborr
AD_SacrumVignette_0.text: I already said no. Now move along - you're scaring away my customers.
AD_SacrumVignette_0.context: NodeContext: Stern but not trying to be horrible

CoffinMummy_006_0.speaker: Ancient Servant
CoffinMummy_006_0.text: I will find... some trinkets... make my beauty shine...

CoffinMummy_006_1.speaker: Ancient Servant
CoffinMummy_006_1.text: Strange creature... your wrappings... are hideous...
CoffinMummy_006_1.context: NodeContext: Mummy voice - judging the player for not being wrappped in bandages

CoffinMummy_006_2.speaker: Ancient Servant
CoffinMummy_006_2.text: Flesh... must be bound... must be contained...
CoffinMummy_006_2.context: NodeContext: Mummy voice - instructing, like you're an idiot

CoffinMummy_006_3.speaker: Ancient Servant
CoffinMummy_006_3.text: Carrion's cloths... so ugly... belonged in the grave...

AD_LumbarReactionAfterPunch_NoPay_0.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
AD_LumbarReactionAfterPunch_NoPay_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player punches the beggar hard in the chest. He staggers with the impact, but remains standing and apparently unharmed. (Bronze anims)

AD_LumbarReactionAfterPunch_NoPay_1.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
AD_LumbarReactionAfterPunch_NoPay_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player punches the beggar hard in the chest. He staggers with the impact, but remains standing and apparently unharmed. (Bronze anims)

AD_GhastCombatLine_0.speaker: Thenar
AD_GhastCombatLine_0.context: NodeContext: Combad AD, getting angrier/louder as the line goes on

AD_PostLumbarBeating_0.speaker: 'Logs' Odoolan
AD_PostLumbarBeating_0.context: NodeContext: A bit breathy - has been punching someone, quite tired.

AD_PostLumbarBeating_1.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
AD_PostLumbarBeating_1.context: NodeContext: Undisturbed by the beating he just took

SacrumVignetteCivilian_0.speaker: Cecee Gaborr
SacrumVignetteCivilian_0.text: I wish I'd something to give, but times are hard for all of us.
SacrumVignetteCivilian_0.context: NodeContext: Feels bad, but standing by her decision

SacrumVignetteCivilian_1.speaker: Cecee Gaborr
SacrumVignetteCivilian_1.text: More beggars than customers these days. S'pose I should count my blessings.
SacrumVignetteCivilian_1.context: NodeContext: With a sigh - getting over the loss of a few gold pieces

CarrionGhoul_003_0.speaker: Ligus
CarrionGhoul_003_0.text: Not allowed up... must go down... customers downstairs...

CarrionGhoul_003_5.speaker: Ligus
CarrionGhoul_003_5.text: Not go up... not safe for clients...

AD_MysticCarrionWorking_0.speaker: Mystic Carrion
AD_MysticCarrionWorking_0.text: Come closer, spirits, I have need of you...
AD_MysticCarrionWorking_0.context: NodeContext: Low, sonorous - in communion with the spirits

AD_MysticCarrionWorking_1.speaker: Mystic Carrion
AD_MysticCarrionWorking_1.text: Do not think to disobey. You are under my compulsion, spectre.
AD_MysticCarrionWorking_1.context: NodeContext: Low, sonorous - in communion with the spirits

AD_MysticCarrionWorking_2.speaker: Mystic Carrion
AD_MysticCarrionWorking_2.text: You have done well. You are released - for now.
AD_MysticCarrionWorking_2.context: NodeContext: Low, sonorous - in communion with the spirits

AD_MysticCarrionWorking_3.speaker: Mystic Carrion
AD_MysticCarrionWorking_3.text: You carry strange tidings. Strange indeed.
AD_MysticCarrionWorking_3.context: NodeContext: Low, sonorous - in communion with the spirits

AD_MysticCarrionTaunt_Turn3_0.speaker: Mystic Carrion
AD_MysticCarrionTaunt_Turn3_0.text: I wonder, which breath will be your last?

Thrumbo_14.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_14.text: I - I told you already. This spot's taken.
Thrumbo_14.context: NodeContext: Trying to mask his desperation, fearful

Thrumbo_18.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_18.text: Please - we don't have time to waste. Carrion's heart must  be destroyed.

Thrumbo_6.speaker: Player
Thrumbo_6.text: I already gave Mystic Carrion his heart back. I'm hardly going to destroy it now.

Thrumbo_27.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_27.text: Please, you must finish the job - Carrion can't be allowed to keep hurting people. You must stop him.
Thrumbo_27.context: NodeContext: grim satisfaction, 'ashes' playing on the player destroying the heart with fire. Urging the player to finish the quest.

Thrumbo_29.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_29.text: That slimy bastard. He hid it in me the whole time...
Thrumbo_29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Thrumbo stands next to his canopic jar, glaring at it. He appeals to the playerNodeContext: Appealing for help

Thrumbo_96.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_96.text: Please - take that foul thing and grind it to dust.

Thrumbo_32.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_32.text: What - what are you doing in here?
Thrumbo_32.context: CinematicNodeContext: (In gameplay - Thrumbo came tumbling out of the wardrobe). Thrumbo looks around, panicked. He spots the player - NodeContext: To self, not aware of the player

Thrumbo_64.speaker: Narrator
Thrumbo_64.text: *You catch the scent of death on the man's clothes, his skin damp with decay. He appears... unwell.*

Thrumbo_5.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_5.text: This is my spot. Go on - find your own.

Thrumbo_88.speaker: Player
Thrumbo_88.text: I came to find you. Mystic Carrion was very keen that I bring you home.

Thrumbo_76.speaker: Player
Thrumbo_76.text: Hello, Thrumbo. Mystic Carrion's told me all about you.

Thrumbo_2.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_2.text: Mystic C-Carrion? You're working for him?

Thrumbo_89.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_89.text: Oh no, no, no. I knew he wouldn't let us leave in peace.

Thrumbo_11.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_11.text: You don't have to help him. He's the one you should be after, not me.

Thrumbo_40.speaker: Player
Thrumbo_40.text: Don't worry - I killed Mystic Carrion already.

Thrumbo_97.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_97.text: You've met him - how can you need more justification than that?
Thrumbo_97.context: NodeContext: Can't beleive he needs to explain further

Thrumbo_59.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_59.text: He - he murdered me. Murdered my friends. Snatched us up right from the dockside and - and made us these things.

Thrumbo_48.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_48.text: Monsters. Fit for gutting and grinding and desecrating the dead. He constantly abuses us, makes us do the worst things you can imagine.

Thrumbo_105.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_105.text: There used to be five of us. My friend Talus... he couldn't take it anymore. One day I saw him drive a coffin nail right through Carrion's skull. Then another. And another...

Thrumbo_34.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_34.text: We thought he'd done it, freed us all. Then when dawn came, Talus seized up suddenly - like something had a grip on him.

Thrumbo_13.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_13.text: We ran to help, but he just... exploded. I got so much blood and pulp in my eyes... When I looked back, Carrion was just stood there - completely unharmed.
Thrumbo_13.context: NodeContext: with a shudder, still can't believe or explain it

Thrumbo_49.speaker: Player
Thrumbo_49.text: I killed Carrion myself. There's no way he'll come back.

Thrumbo_22.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_22.text: You killed him? Then it's too late... unless you can find a way to stop him resurrecting.
Thrumbo_22.context: NodeContext: Dawning horror - he knows how this ends

Thrumbo_28.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_28.text: Since Talus died, I've been watching Carrion, trying to figure out his secret. And I think... I think he's a mummy lord.
Thrumbo_28.context: NodeContext: Hesitant to share his theory, you might think it's stupid

Thrumbo_33.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_33.text: It's an ancient, evil being who refused to die. Who cannot die. I used to hear about them in stories, and I can't think of another explanation.

Thrumbo_70.speaker: Player
Thrumbo_70.text: He does seem rather keen on bandages...

Thrumbo_94.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_94.text: He likes to pretend he's not a walking corpse like the rest of us. Beneath those rags, he's as rotten as we are.

Thrumbo_67.speaker: Player
Thrumbo_67.text: Don't be ridiculous. Mummy lords are legends and nothing more.

Thrumbo_21.speaker: Player
Thrumbo_21.text: As undead go, mummy lords are particularly hard to put to rest. I hope you're wrong.

Thrumbo_15.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_15.text: He as good as told me so himself!

Thrumbo_9.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_9.text: After Talus died, Carrion blindfolded me and took me to a strange place. A foul, ancient place, somewhere the living wouldn't dare to tread.

Thrumbo_110.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_110.text: Down there, he showed me a jar. Said it contained the secret to eternal life, and if I behaved, he would share it with me.

Thrumbo_56.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_56.text: I - I think it was his heart.

Thrumbo_83.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_83.text: I'm not stupid. I know what he did to my friend. Gods, how I'd love to smash that bastard jar. That's how you kill mummy lords, you know.

Thrumbo_61.speaker: Player
Thrumbo_61.text: I already found his lair. The jar you saw - he hid it inside your body.

Thrumbo_7.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_7.text: What? His rotten heart was inside me this whole time?
Thrumbo_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Thrumbo looks down at his chest, confused.

Thrumbo_73.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_73.text: Urgh, get it out. I have to get it out.

Thrumbo_45.speaker: Player
Thrumbo_45.text: I'll find and destroy the jar. Where should I start?

Thrumbo_103.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_103.text: I'm not sure, but in the house, beneath Carrion's salon, there's a chamber. He never lets anyone down there, so it must be hiding something important. Perhaps it's there.

Thrumbo_107.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_107.text: I don't want to die like Talus did. I want to live. Well... you know what I mean.

Thrumbo_12.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_12.text: But be careful if you return to Carrion - he'll know you spoke to me. Make sure he doesn't see or smell you. He'll turn you into one of us and he'll know I sent you.

Thrumbo_78.speaker: Player
Thrumbo_78.text: Let's not be too hasty. You say this jar grants immortality?

Thrumbo_87.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_87.text: Don't let yourself be tempted by it - whatever's in that jar must be destroyed.

Thrumbo_68.speaker: Player
Thrumbo_68.text: I think I'd rather just kill you.

Thrumbo_8.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Thrumbo tries to shield/protect himself (leading into combat)NodeContext: Scared

Thrumbo_54.speaker: Player
Thrumbo_54.text: A theory I have no intention of testing. I'm not getting involved.

Thrumbo_37.speaker: Narrator
Thrumbo_37.text: *If you didn't know better, you'd swear your refusal had broken the zombie boy's heart. Fortunately, it stopped beating some time ago.*

Thrumbo_3.speaker: Player
Thrumbo_3.text: That's horrible. All right, I'll help you. What can I do?

Thrumbo_71.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_71.text: We'd have to stop him resurrecting somehow. But I don't know how.

Thrumbo_30.speaker: Player
Thrumbo_30.text: Do you know how Carrion brought himself back?

Thrumbo_60.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_60.text: If I knew that, I'd have tried to kill him myself.

Thrumbo_65.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_65.text: I know this is going to sound strange, but I've been watching him, trying to figure it out and... I think he's a mummy lord.

Thrumbo_79.speaker: Player
Thrumbo_79.text: Quite the story. Now, will you die quietly, or are we doing this the hard way?

Thrumbo_95.speaker: Player
Thrumbo_95.text: You're the price he demanded for his aid.

Thrumbo_74.speaker: Player
Thrumbo_74.text: I don't think so. He's offered a generous price for bringing you back to him.

Thrumbo_57.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_57.text: I don't understand. We're nothing to him, nothing to anyone. He never stopped telling us that.

Thrumbo_85.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_85.text: I wasn't doing any harm, just trying to beg a few coin to get by and he - he murdered me. Murdered my friends. Made us into these things.
Thrumbo_85.context: NodeContext: Sorrowful - hates what he's become

Thrumbo_98.speaker: Player
Thrumbo_98.text: How did you end up working for Mystic Carrion?

Thrumbo_86.speaker: Player
Thrumbo_86.text: Shouldn't have made a deal with him then, should you?

Thrumbo_23.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_23.text: Made a deal with him? You think I asked for this?

Thrumbo_63.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_63.text: Me and my friends, we were beggars. Used to sleep down near the docks when the Fists were on patrol. Carrion found us down there. He murdered us, made us like this.

Thrumbo_51.speaker: Player
Thrumbo_51.text: Is everything all right? I think you might be sick.

Thrumbo_77.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_77.text: Er, yes, now that you mention it. *Cough.* Probably contagious. Best not come too close.
Thrumbo_77.context: NodeContext: Coughing, leaning into your assumption so you'll back off.

Thrumbo_47.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_47.text: Yeah. Every beggar's got a spot to kip in. And this is mine. So clear off.

Thrumbo_17.speaker: Player
Thrumbo_17.text: Trust me - I have no interest in staying here.

Thrumbo_19.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_19.text: Oh. Well. That's all right, then.
Thrumbo_19.context: NodeContext: Unsure if you're telling the truth

Thrumbo_104.speaker: Narrator
Thrumbo_104.text: *The man's stench is unmistakable - death, decay, despair. This must be Thrumbo, the runaway Mystic Carrion was so eager for you to retrieve.*

Thrumbo_75.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_75.text: Stop making so much noise. You'll have the Fists sniffing around.
Thrumbo_75.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standing, but with the air/posture of soemone trying to be as inconspicuous as possibleNodeContext: Trying to mask his desperation, fearful

Thrumbo_81.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_81.text: You came back! Please, tell me you found a way to destroy Mystic Carrion?
Thrumbo_81.context: NodeContext: Trying to mask his desperation, fearful

Thrumbo_109.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_109.text: Please - if you won't help me, then just leave me be.
Thrumbo_109.context: NodeContext: Trying to mask his desperation, fearful

Thrumbo_42.speaker: Player
Thrumbo_42.text: I know where Carrion keeps his canopic jar. It's inside your chest.

Thrumbo_106.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_106.text: No, no, no! We haven't found the heart yet!

Thrumbo_55.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_55.text: We're running out of time - you have to find it. Or come dawn, he'll be back, and he'll kill us both.

Thrumbo_72.speaker: Player
Thrumbo_72.text: Carrion made other jars. Any idea what I should do with them?

Thrumbo_91.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_91.text: You should destroy them. Get rid of every rotten part of him.
Thrumbo_91.context: NodeContext: Determined, could be an end node in some cases

Thrumbo_39.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_39.text: Be careful, though. He'll know you did it, and he'll be really angry.

Thrumbo_100.speaker: Player
Thrumbo_100.text: Not so fast. I destroyed Mystic Carrion's heart.

Thrumbo_62.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_62.text: You - you did? Then what are you waiting for?
Thrumbo_62.context: NodeContext: Disbelief, turning to excitement. Urging player to complete their quest

Thrumbo_69.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_69.text: You must destroy the rest of him! Put that monster in the grave where he belongs.

Thrumbo_101.speaker: Player
Thrumbo_101.text: I destroyed another jar belonging to Carrion.

Thrumbo_50.speaker: Thrumbo
Thrumbo_50.text: Good riddance to it, but you still need to find the heart. Without that, he'll never be stopped.

PAD_ReactToJarDestroyed_0.speaker: Player
PAD_ReactToJarDestroyed_0.text: That did the trick. Nothing but ashes left of that jar now.

CarrionGhoul_000_0.speaker: Ulnar
CarrionGhoul_000_0.context: NodeContext: Snuffling and snorting, struggling to string the thought together

CarrionGhoul_000_1.speaker: Ulnar
CarrionGhoul_000_1.text: You smell of Carrion's flesh. Hope he tasted good.

CarrionGhoul_000_2.speaker: Ulnar
CarrionGhoul_000_2.context: NodeContext: Pondering a problem, not threating you

CarrionGhoul_000_3.speaker: Ulnar
CarrionGhoul_000_3.context: NodeContext: Sniffing as though appreciating a delicious smell

MorbusGirl_0.speaker: Pookums
MorbusGirl_0.text: He won't listen to me! I told him it's naughty to play in graveyards.

MorbusGirl_1.speaker: Pookums
MorbusGirl_1.text: I don't know why you'd want to play here anyway. Too much dead stuff.

PAD_AncientLairCurseReaction_0.speaker: Player
PAD_AncientLairCurseReaction_0.text: Feel that? This house doesn't want us here.
PAD_AncientLairCurseReaction_0.context: NodeContext: Kalarach: Resigned to more shenanigans

CarrionGhoul_002_0.speaker: Carpal
CarrionGhoul_002_0.context: NodeContext: Struggling to string the idea together

CarrionGhoul_002_1.speaker: Carpal
CarrionGhoul_002_1.context: NodeContext: Struggling to string the idea together

CarrionGhoul_002_2.speaker: Carpal
CarrionGhoul_002_2.context: NodeContext: Instructing the player to go downstairs. More urgent than first instruction - thinks you don't understand

CarrionGhoul_002_3.speaker: Carpal
CarrionGhoul_002_3.context: NodeContext: Instructing the player to go downstairs, struggling to string the idea together

PAD_EnteredLabAncientLair_0.speaker: Player
PAD_EnteredLabAncientLair_0.text: A gruesome sight. A necromantic ritual, perhaps?

AD_MysticCarrionCastsPutridExplosion_002.speaker: Mystic Carrion
AD_MysticCarrionCastsPutridExplosion_002.context: NodeContext: de-MER-ge (hard g) in KAR-ne (/de'mer.ge ɪn 'kar.ne/)

CoffinMummy_005_0.speaker: Ancient Servant
CoffinMummy_005_0.text: Better here... than unmourned... in an empty tomb...
CoffinMummy_005_0.context: NodeContext: Mummy voice - making his mind up (not too expressive)

CoffinMummy_005_1.speaker: Ancient Servant
CoffinMummy_005_1.text: Why am I risen? This is not... where I was left...
CoffinMummy_005_1.context: NodeContext: Mummy voice - confused, not really expecting an answer

CoffinMummy_005_2.speaker: Ancient Servant
CoffinMummy_005_2.text: My tomb... I wished to be... in my tomb...

CoffinMummy_005_3.speaker: Ancient Servant
CoffinMummy_005_3.text: He is gone... we are freed...
CoffinMummy_005_3.context: NodeContext: Mummy voice - making his mind up (not too expressive)
